loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Grace Association Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatu S., Kadie B., Isatu C. and Gbassay S. of the Grace Association Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town market, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,100,000.00 to enable them expand their businesses. With a business expansion, they will be able to make more sales, better profit and thus improving their well-being. 

Fatu S. (left) is the leader of the group. Fatu is approximately forty-five years of age, she was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have two children and two foster children all of whom are still attending schools.  Fatu sells dried fish and has been in this business for over ten years now. With this loan, she will travel as far as Yeliboya village to buy the fish. A basket of dried fish at Yeliboya costs Le 800,000.00, thus Fatu will have to add some money of her own to buy a basket of fish.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open the same business at a new location

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn T. is from the village of Jasaan , Misamis Oriental. She is 41-years-old. Jonalyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia M. is 52 years old and her lone child is in college. She lives among the poor communities of Tramo, Pasay City. Alicia runs a small sari-sari (general) store located in her house. She also cooks food for requesting customers. She earns P6,000 a month and a large portion of her profit goes to her child’s college education. She believes that education is the best gift she can give her child. It was in 2005 when she heard about, and eventually became a member of, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She has just applied for a new loan of P25,000 to purchase more stock for her store. This will be her 11th loan with CCT. Alicia dreams of owning a bigger grocery store. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena C. is from the village of Mialem. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Elena owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to renovate or make improvements to her house. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate or make improvements to her house

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Oretha D. the leader of a five-member loan group called "God’s Blessings." She is 37 years old and married. She has six children, ages 4 months to 21 years old. Their educational levels range from kindergarten to 9th grade. Oretha also cares for three in-laws. She is an illiterate due to poverty.

Oretha and her family lives and work in the dry rice market community in Barnesville, which is north of Monrovia, the capital of  Liberia. The market sells only ingredients for a local dish called dry rice. 

Oretha sells charcoal and raw rice. She buys the charcoal and rice wholesale and sells it retails from a table to the residents of the Barnesville dry rice market community near Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 22 years and hopes to improve her shop.

To encourage customers to continue patronizing her business, Oretha sells clean and high-quality rice at an affordable price. She started her business with LD$150.00 of her savings from selling peanuts and seasoning materials. She needs this loan to purchase more charcoal and rice to improve her business. Oretha dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house for them in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and rice

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 28 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 2 hijas: Katia de 7 y Maria de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de cerveza, su puesto está ubicado en el centro minero “La Rinconada”, y todos los fines de semana traslada muchas cajas de cerveza para renovar las que han sido consumidas durante la semana. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las cajas de cerveza desde la ciudad de Juliaca hasta la mina, ya que es un viaje muy largo y cansado. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Luz con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y colaboradora. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará más cajas de cerveza, ya que se ha incrementado la demanda.
texts.en:
Luz, 28, is a very loving mother. She lives in one of her family member's homes with her two daughters: Katia, who is 7, and Maria, who is 5. They are the motive for all of her efforts. She has a business selling beer. Her stand is located in the mining center called, "La Rinconada." Every weekend, she moves many boxes of beer to renew what has been consumed during the week. She is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman. This is why her customers prefer her over her competition. What she likes the most about her job is talking with her customers since this makes her long work days more enjoyable. She has done this work for 2 years and she thinks the most difficult part about it is transporting the boxes of beer from the city of Juliaca to the mine. It is a long and tiring trip. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can offer her customers better service. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do this. She is a very happy and collaborative member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more boxes of beer since her demand has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her amount of merchandise

loans.name: Por Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
POR SIEMPRE AMIGAS
Flor tiene una bodega hace muchos años, sus ingresos solo le alcanza para mantener el negocio y no le permite costear los estudios D. su hijo que ya terminó la secundaria, ella nos comenta que con el préstamo recibido abrirá una pequeña librería con la ayuda D.  su mama, con el cual espera obtener mayores ingresos.
Por estas fiestas naviD.ñas Mercedes aprovechará en vender panetones, regalos, vinos y juguetes a todos sus vecinos, y espera juntar el suficiente capital para que el siguiente año pueda alquilar algún puesto en el mercado ya que en estos meses no le ha ido bien en su negocio. 
La secretaria Graciela venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo a pedidos,  en este negocio no tiene muchas ganancias, a veces solo alcanza para comer una vez al día ya que tiene que mantener a sus 6 hijos,  pero ella es muy optimista, menciona que los niños son su razón D. ser y el motor que la impulsa todos los días. 
Los socios están contentos con los préstamos ya que EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD les ha sido D. mucha ayuda ya que pueden comprar productos en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
FRIENDS FOREVER Flor has had a grocery store for years . Her revenue is just enough to maintain her business and doesn't allow her to finance her son's education since he graduated from high school. She comments that with the recieved loan, she will open a small bookstore with her mother's help. She hopes to make greater profits with the bookstore. For the Christmas holidays Mercedes will take the opportunity to sell Christmas pastries, gifts, wines, and toys to all of her neighbors. With this she hopes to save up enough money so that next year she can rent a stand in the market since buisness has not been going well these past months. Secretary Graciela sells beauty prodcuts by catalog or orders. She does not make much profit with this buisness. At times she only has enough money to eat once a day since she has to raise her 6 children. In spite of all this she is optimistic and mentions that her children are the reason and the motivation that drive her everyday. The members are happy with the loans since EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD has helped them much by allowing them to buy wholesale and make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Sulma Elena

texts.es:
La señora Sulma C. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y con dos hijos en edades escolares a los que mantiene y les proporciona las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella a diario trabaja con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cal para construcción ya que requiere adquirir dicha cal para venderla porque anteriormente ya ha vendido este producto pero ahora no cuenta con este y por ende necesita adquirirlo. Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para así mejorar su nivel de vida por medio de la venta de la cal para obtener los ingresos y suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sulma C. stands out for being a very hardworking woman with two children of school age who she supports and gives them the necessary conditions to give her children a good start in life. Daily, she works to better their living conditions.

The loan will be used to buy construction lime, since she needs it to sell it because she has sold this product before but now she does not have it, and needs it. She hopes that her loan will be given to her so that she can improve her standard of living by selling lime and have the necessary income to meet the necessities of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lime for construction.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
doña Rosa Margarita L. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en guasaule frontera Honduras-Nicaragua. es una sra. muy activa, se dedica a la venta de carne de res por libras.
compra la carne en un destazadero y obtiene buen precio cuando la compra, pero en estos momentos no tiene mucho capital para comprar mas carne y a veces se le termina rapido el producto y se queda sin vender y pierde ganancias.
vende su producto a varios conductores de equipo pesado y tambien vende a los vecinos de guasaule.
aqui muy temprano hay movimiento de personas esto hace que todo el dia sea activo para las ventas.
necesita el credito para comprar mas carne y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Margarita L., 50, lives in Guasaule on the Honduras-Nicaragua frontier. She is very active, selling beef by the pound. She buys the meat from a slaughterhouse at a good price, but right now she does not have much capital to buy the meat. Sometimes she runs out of meat rapidly and is left with nothing to sell and profits lost. She sells her products to various heavy equipment drivers and also around the neighborhoods of Guasaule. People begin moving around very early, so she is busy all day long with her sales. She needs this loan in order to buy more meat in order to earn more profits for the sustenance of her family and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 33-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and two children. He has been working in agriculture since 2004. He plants fruits and vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, apples and mint, as well as other products depending on the season. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase seeds and repair his car. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. 
His customers are his friends and neighbors, as well as fruit and vegetable shops. He decided to start his business because it was his family’s business. In the future, he hopes to improve his work and maybe buy a bigger piece of land for growing his fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and repair his car

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn P. is from the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Jelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business.
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Felipa Sixtina

texts.es:
Felipa tiene 63 años D. edad, enviudó hace 29 años y tiene siente hijos, todos ya independizados. Vive junto a dos nietos en el sector Chuin del distrito D. Paiján, provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace dos años posee un pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y menestras en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que el negocio empezó debido a la demanda D. algunos productos D. primera necesidad por parte D. sus vecinos, ya que estos no podian adquirirlos facilmente porque la zona en donD. vive se encuentra alejada del centro D. la ciudad. 

Felipa compra diversos productos D. uso diario en pocas cantidades y los ofrece a sus clientes al crédito, ya que la mayoría D. ellos trabajan en una empresa agroindustrial que le paga mensualmente. Ella también trabaja como obrera D. la mecionada empresa por lo que se identifica con la situación D. sus clientes.

Felipa se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos D. escolaridad D. los dos nietos que tiene a su cargo. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.

Ella es una mujer carismática y muy trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus nietos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Philippa is 63 years old and was widowed 29 years ago. She has 7 children, who are now all independent. She lives with two grandchildren in the district of Paiján Chuin, Ascope in the province of La Libertad region, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past two years, she runs a small business selling groceries and beans in her home. She says the business began because of the demand for certain staples by her neighbors, which could not be acquired easily as they live in an area far away from downtown. Felipa purchases various goods for daily use in small quantities and offers customers credit, since most of them work in an agricultural company that pays monthly. She also works as a laborer for that company and can identify with her clients. Felipa is requesting a loan from field partner Alternative Edpyme of 1000 nuevos soles. She plans to spend the loan on the school fees of her two grandchildren under her charge. She has previously worked with this field partner and has proved to be timely and responsible with her payments. She is charismatic and hard working. Her greatest desire is to see her grandchildren turn into successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees for the grandchildren in her charge.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix a sus 63 años, continúa dedicándose a la agricultura. Es soltero y junto a él, vive su hermana menor Eutenia y su sobrina Xianela,  en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. La dedicación que le brindó a su madre en vida, hizo que Félix, no tenga su propia familia, sin embargo no le quitaron la voluntad de trabajar como se debe, por eso lleva 40 años dedicado a la siembra de alverja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, en sus terrenos propios y con la ayuda de operarios que contrató, pueden aún mantenerla, además su hermana menor la apoya preparando el almuerzo diariamente. Paralelo a esta actividad, también se dedica al oficio de albañil, porque siempre se esforzó por brindarle lo mejor a sus seres queridos, es que le gusta lo que hace, considerándolo como un padre en la familia. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar alverjas, ya que disfruta ver como crece y florece esta planta. En el futuro piensa reparar y mejorar la construcción de su casa, para que sus sobrinos dispongan del inmueble, de igual manera desea arrendar sus chacras, para tener mayores utilidades y con ello continuar ahorrando, para así asegurar su vejez. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, además está satisfecho de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo bien organizado y en donde aprendió a ahorrar. Entretanto solicita, dos mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar ocho sacos de abono y dos bolsas de semilla de alverja.
texts.en:
Felix who is 63 years old continues to devote himself to agriculture. He is single and lives with her younger sister Eutenia and niece Xianela, in the house he inherited from his parents. The devotion he had towards his mother while she was living caused Felix not to have his own family. However, that didn't make him want to work any less, that is why she's been working for 40 years growing peas, potatoes, corn, and other vegetables in his own land and with help that he has hired. He is still able to take care of his land and his sister supports him by preparing his lunch every day. Additionally, he is also a bricklayer. He always made an effort to provide for his loved ones and that's why he likes his job and the reason that he is consided a father by his own family. What he enjoys most is to grow peas since he likes to see how the plant grows. In the future he plans to repair and improve his house so that his nephews can have it. Additionally, he wants to rent his land so that he can increase his earnings and continue savings and thereby secure his retirement. This is his tenth loan with MFP. He is glad to belong to his communal group because it is very organized and taught him how to save. He is asking for PEN 2,500 to purchase eight bags of fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Obioha

texts.en:
Virgina is 47years old, married and has six children under her care. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She sells plantain, yams and potatoes and has been in this business for over nine years. She makes sure customers demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.
Virgina is requesting for a loan of NGN50,000  to purchase yams and potatoes in bulk at a discount for sale. She says thank you and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase yam and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Raeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Алийма, 44, разведена. Она в одиночку воспитала 4 детей: Сыновьям (22,16,14), дочери 20 лет. Старший сын и дочь находятся на заработках в РФ, младшие сыновья школьники. Клиент в настоящее время откармливает 2 корову, телку и 7 овец. На кредит она планирует закупить овец для откорма и разведения.

Кундузхан 61 лет. Ее супруг член крестьянского хозяйства, а также получает пенсию около 70 долларов. Она сама занимается животноводством. В настоящее время откармливает одну корову с теленком. На кредит она планирует закупить 2-х бычков.

Сардальхон 67 лет. Ее единственный сын ранее работал на хлопкозаводе, на данный момент в столице на заработках. Клиент откармливает для продажи 18 овец и 2 козы. На сумму получаемого кредита она закупит 2-х козлят для откорма и разведения.

Райма, 58, вдова. У нее 3 детей, сыновьям 21 и 24 лет, дочери 18 лет. Сыновья на зароботках в РФ, дочь помогает в бизнесе. Клиент дома откармливает одну корову.На кредит клиент планирует закупить овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aliyma is 44 years old, divorced. She raised 4 children on her own. Her sons are 22, 16 and 14 years old, and daughter is 20 years old. The oldest son and daughter work in the Russian Federation, and the younger sons are school students. The client is currently fattening 2 cows, a heifer and 7 sheep. She plans to use this loan to buy sheep for fattening and breeding. Kunduzhan is 61 years old. Her husband is a member of a farmers’ collective and also receives a pension in the amount of about 70 dollars. Kunduzhan is involved in animal husbandry. Currently, she is fattening one cow with a calf. She plans to use the loan to buy 2 bulls. Sardalhon is 67 years old. Her only son previously worked at a cotton factory and is currently working in the capital. The client is fattening 18 sheep and 2 goats for sale. She will use the loan to buy 2 goats for fattening and breeding. Rayma is 58 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. Her sons are 21 and 24 years old, and daughter is 18 years old. The sons work in Russia, and the daughter helps her with the business. The client is fattening one cow at home. Rayma plans to use the loan to buy sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Lourgen Magsayo's Group

texts.en:
Lourgen M., 30 years old, is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamis City Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lourgen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourgen runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has just started this business.

In June 2009, Lourgen joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Lourgen is requesting her third loan, for 14,995 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Sarah Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God's Blessing. She is 34 years old, single and has two children who are 4 and 9 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints and she cares for one sibling.

For three years, he has been selling salt, flour, cooking oil and sugar at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with one bag of sugar and now is able to add flour, salt and cooking oil. She says insufficient cash to purchase more of the kinds of goods she sells is a major challenge to her business.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, flour, cooking oil and salt. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

He hopes to grow her business and to continue to support her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Brenda is inset at lower right.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
Vỹ  Ngô Thị, age 48, lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong-tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Vỹ  is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Mai 2 nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).
 
Vỹ  is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Vỹ  owns and operates a manufacturing business. She manufactures and sells wood products to local businesses and community members. Vỹ  has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
  
Vỹ  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.     She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the first loan she has taken out from SEDA. Vỹ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

Nguyễn Thị T., age 48, is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Nghiêm Thị P., age 24, is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Trần Thị H., age 20, is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Nguyễn Thị Nhị, age 26, is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Nguyễn Thị D., age 39, is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Ngô Thị T., age 42, is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Ngô Thị T., age 37, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 5 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et  qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous- préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, HAÏRRA T., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,9hectare d’arachide et de maïs.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
"Bendiya 5" is a group of ten married women averaging 40 years of age and three children each.  They live in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region, (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  They are now on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  The crops they grow include peanuts, pearl millet, and corn. With this new loan, Ms. Haïrra T., the president of the group, intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and also to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about 1.9 hectare of peanuts and corn.  After the harvests, the produce is sold in Dioïla City and Fana City to a customer base composed of women and men.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for supplies, farm equipment, and manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Adjowa Atche N.

texts.en: Adjowa A. lives in Lome, Togo and sells charcoal and millet grain from her home. She has been working in this activity since 2005. Normally, Madame A. purchases her products further north in Togo, and this time she has requested a loan of 200,000 CFA in order to assist her purchases and augment her stock of millet and charcoal. Madame A. has one child.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and millet.

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jene is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn S. is 36 years old and sells fruits in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about two years and she makes US$ 5 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation, and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to increase her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married woman with five children from Lebanon. She is a proud new business owner of a school supplies shop. She also offers gadgets and gift products in her shop. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her inventory selection before the school season. She has high hopes for the future of her business; she is looking to continue expansion of her business in the coming year. 

Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes.

loans.use: to expand her inventory selection

loans.name: Gladys Murunga

texts.en:
Gladys Murunga M. is 42 years old. She is married to Daniel Katembe, who is a farmer. This also is a source of additional income for the family. They have three children, aged 20, 16 and 14 years old, respectively. Their residential place is in Eldoret-Kenya. 

She sells cereals and has been in this business for the past three years with a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Gladys learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. She is applying for her second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD, with which she intends to buy 10 bags of ground nuts. With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase her own plot of land.

In the future, Gladys wishes to expand her business and also to have a dairy farm. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Moses Kilili

texts.en:
Moses is a 32-year-old, single farmer. He has been in the horticulture business for a period of about three years with a monthly profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings.  

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution) and this is his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully clearing the previous three. He intends to buy a water pump for his horticulture farm. 

He hopes to expand his farm to enable him to get more produce for sale.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for his farm

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old single mother. She runs a computer accessories shop. She has been in the business for four years with an income of 19,000 per month.She has no history with any other microfinance institution.

Caroline was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET which she intends to use to buy more hard disks, mother boards and other stock for her business.

She hopes to have her business expand and build her own house, educate her child, and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy hard disks, mother boards and other stock for the business

loans.name: Nanondiral Group

texts.fr: Nanondiral  est un groupe de 4 femmes qui habitent dans la localité de Bambilor. Elles exercent  la même  activité et pratiquent le commerce de lait frais, lait caillé et d’autres diverses marchandises. Elles ont une expérience  de plus de 10 ans dans leur activité. Elles parviennent avec leurs bénéfices à régler  certains leurs besoins. Le groupe est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis aout 2010 et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs en vue de renforcer leur fond de commerce.  Leur objectif est d’accroitre leur épargne et de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses pour leurs petits besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Nanondiral is a group of four women who live in Bambilor. They are in the same business, selling fresh milk, curdled milk, and various other products. They have more than ten years' experience in this business. With their profits they are able to meet some of their needs. 

The group has been a member of the Bambilor branch of UIMCEC since August 2010 and is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs in order to boost working capital. Their goal is to increase their savings and better meet their expenses for minor daily needs.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Juan cliente que se dedica a la elaboración de pan quien a diario debe despertar  a las 12 de la noche para posteriormente realizar  su producción del día, el señor es una persona que se encuentra sola no tiene hijos ni padres  ni ayudante, solo realiza su producción y su posterior comercialización, el elabora y vende sus productos, actualmente necesita el dinero para la compra de un horno mas grande  para poder ampliar su negocio e incrementar su producción, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable.
texts.en: Juan's business is making bread.  Every day he must get up at midnight to bake his bread for the day.  Juan is on his own.  He doesn't have children, or parents, or an assistant.  He makes his products on his own and sells them on his own.  He currently needs money to buy a bigger oven so that he can expand his business and increase his production.  He is a very hard-working and responsible young man.

loans.use: To buy a bigger oven

loans.name: San Cayetano I Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Modesta Martínez y la Sra. Francisca O., quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son  mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
Ellas  son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, tienen Despensa, Almacén, Copetín, y Casillas, tienen huertas comunitarias y comercializan sus propios productos. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Felicia quien se dedica a la elaboración de dulce de maní, y así logra obtener el ingreso para ayudar a su familia y al  mismo tiempo pagar sus cuotas. 
Sus clientes conforman varios negocios de la zona, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de dulces como maní, azúcar, leche y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Modesta Martínez and Francisca O. who approached Fundación Paraguaya's Office to find out more about the Enterprising Women's Committee Program.  They invited their friends and acquaintances from their neighborhood and formed a group to get ahead and  improve their lifestyles.  These are hard-working and humble women who must earn money to support themselves every day.

The women work independently in their different business activities which include selling clothes, selling meals, running a grocery store, wholesaler's, café, and sales booths.  They have community market gardens and they sell their own produce.

One of the committee's members is Felicia who makes 'dulce de maní' (a kind of peanut brittle) which makes her income with which she can help her family and also meet her loan repayments.  Felicia's customers are different businesses in the area.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies so that she can keep making her 'dulce de maní' such as peanuts, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon has been dedicated to cattle farming for 7 years.  He is married and the father of 3 children.  He makes a great effort to meet the needs of his children and to bring sustenance to his humble home.  His greatest need now is to buy young cattle to expand his business.  For this reason, Komiljon turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business grow.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the his business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells sacks of maize and gari at Breman near Elmina. Esi has been through senior high school. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi has been in this trade for 10 years now. She assists her husband in payment of the family's bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

In this pricture Esi, is showing some of the gari she sells.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es:
REYNALDO ANTONIO L. A. ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA TRABAJA COMO GUARDA DE SEGURIDAD DESDE HACE VEINTE AÑOS, EL ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS SOLO DEPENDE DE EL UNO.
EL ACUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION COMO: PISO, CEMENTO, ARENA PARA SU CASA DE HABITACION.
HA TRABAJADO CINCO PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio L. A. is from the city of Managua.  He has worked as a security guard for 20 years.  He is a father of two children that depend on him.  He is coming back to CEPRODEL to request a new loan to buy construction materials to improve his home, such as cement and sand for the floor of his house.  He has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 loans and they have all been to improve his home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from the village of Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda runs a business in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities. Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 80,000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and will also use some for working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and capital

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es: Gaudencio, de 61 años, es un hombre ejemplar. En compañía de su esposa July y de su hijo Ido, viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. Hace más de 40 años comenzó con la siembra de productos oriundos del lugar como: papa, arveja y habas. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenas ganancias tanto así que compró un camión con el que trasporta su cosecha; ya que Gaudencio no solo vende en el mercado de la localidad de Huasahuasi, sino viaja constantemente a la costa del país trasportando papa en mayores cantidades para proveer a otros mercados. Por otro lado tiene 6 vacas con el que produce queso, y todos los domingos baja a la ciudad de Tarma para comercializarlos. Ahora contento con el trabajo que realiza desea seguir mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, manifiesta que será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Gaudencio, cosechará dentro de estos meses, varios sacos de papa y arveja; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 100 sacos de abono orgánico pare esparcirlos entre sus cultivos preparándolos para la siguiente producción.
texts.en: Gaudencio is 61 years old. He is an exemplary man. He lives with his wife July and his son Ido in their own home, located in the community of San Juan de la Libertad. More than 40 years ago, he began to plant products native to the area such as: potatoes, peas and beans. He has been able to make good earnings this whole time and was able to buy a truck to transport his harvest. Gaudencio doesn't just sell in the local market of the community of Huasahuasi. He travels constantly to the country's coast, transporting large quantities of potatoes to supply other markets. He also has 6 cows with which he produces cheese, and every Sunday he goes down to the city of Tarma to sell it. Now that he is happy with his job, he wants to improve the quality of his products. He belongs to the community bank “Capital Semillera” [Seed Capital], and this is the tenth loan that he has had with MFP. He states that he will be responsible with the payments. Gaudencio will harvest several sacks of potatoes and peas in these next few months. That is why he is planning to buy 100 sacks of organic fertilizer with the loan in oder to spread them on his crops to prepare them for the next cycle.

loans.use: To buy 100 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 50-year-old mother and wife. Tamam has a big family with two daughters and five sons. Shadi, Fatima, Mahmoud and Basima are college students, while Hamza, Karam and Sameera are school students. Tamam and her husband run a home products store in Dier Al-Balah in Gaza Strip. Tamam's sons help her run the store. Tamam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a large number of items to enrich the variety they sell such as plates, table kits, pans, etc.

Tamam's son, Mahmoud, who helps run the store, is photographed instead of Tamam, since she is a conservative woman as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home products and items to increase her profit.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is 27 years old, married and father of one. For three years, he has been selling household goods such as cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.  He also sells clothes for extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of growth in his business.  He hopes to open three outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, basins, buckets, cups and plates.

loans.name: El Eden 3 Group

texts.en:
Diosa is the coordinator of her group El Eden (Eden) 3, and her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children.

Diosa is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her Beauty Salon by purchasing a large quantity of beauty products and to repair some of the structure. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. She said that her most difficult challenge is to help her children to become professionals, by attending school up to university.

She started doing her business after she worked in a beauty salon and then decided to have her own business. For her future she is dreaming of building apartment and renting them.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and rebuild he rlocal  business

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel B. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old. Noel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Noel owns & operates a business venture making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Noel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like sugar, flour & eggs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like sugar, flour & eggs

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna de 33 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Xiomara de 4 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La inmensa vocación a la educación que tiene Giovanna, a hecho que ponga una escuela en el distrito de Puente Piedra en la ciudad de Lima, su centro educativo brinda los servicios de educación inicial y primaria, motivo por el cual tiene numerosos alumnos, los padres confían mucho en esta institución, ya que ella se ha encargado de que la educación que se imparte en las aulas sea la mejor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede interactuar con los niños, ya que disfruta mucho de su compañía, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar que a los niños no les ocurra nada malo, ya que son muy traviesos y siempre hay la posibilidad de que se hagan daño. Con el tiempo desea mejorar las instalaciones de su escuela, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus alumnos. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mobiliarios para mejorar la educación en su escuela.
texts.en: Giovanna is 33 years old and she is a very humble and hardworking woman. She lives in a house of her own together with her beloved 4-year old daughter, Xiomara. She is ready to work very hard to improve the quality of their life. The immense dedication Giovanna has to teaching has driven her to set up a school in the district of Puente Piedra in the city of Lima. Her educational institution provides basic and primary education, which is why she has numerous students. The parents trust this institution because she has made sure that the education that is imparted in her classrooms is the best. What she most enjoys about her work is being able to interact with the children. She loves their company. She has 10 years in the business and she considers the most difficult part to be keeping the children safe from harm. They are very active and there is always the chance they might get hurt. In time she wants to improve the school infrastructure to provide her students with a better quality of service. This is the seventh loan she has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She knows that she must make her payments on time and she is ready to do so.  She is a very well liked member of her community bank. With the two thousand neuvos soles requested she will purchase more desks to improve her school.

loans.use: to purchase desks to equip her classrooms.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Inocencia tiene 29 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos  de 12, 3 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en su panadería, ella junto a su conyugue tienen una panadería y ambos trabajan mano a  mano, la socia apoya con la compra de harina, manteca, leña; la socia también tiene un negocio alterno a este ella vende productos de salud estos productos son de omnilife y ella los distribuye según el pedido que obtenga. La socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de leña, harina, manteca para la a panadería y otra parte de esta es para comprar productos de salud para tener listo y vender.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Torrechayoc II" [Lord of Torrechayoc II] and lives in the Urubamba district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

Inocencia, 29, lives in a committed relationship and has two children who are 12 and 13 years of age. The member works in the bakery which she has with her spouse and where they both work side by side. The member provides support in the form of flour, lard and firewood purchases. The member has an additional business in which she sells health products from Omnilife. She distributes the products according to the orders she receives. The member wishes to have the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of firewood, flour and lard for the bakery, and another portion is for purchasing health products so she may have them on hand and ready for sale. 

The member infinitely values and appreciates the loan that was granted since this allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. Thus she commits herself to making her payments within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of firewood, flour and health products.

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.en:
Khisrav is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and the father of one child.  Khisrav is engaged in producing and selling dried fruit. He purchases fresh fruits from the villages of Khamirchu, and then he dries and resells them. He purchases about 1500-2000 kg of dried fruits.  After packing them, he sends them to the Russia Federation to fill orders.  He wants to increase his profit.

Khisrav would like a loan of 6000 TJS to purchase a car for the transportation of his dried fruits, in order to minimize his transportation expenses.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Fatima Benigna

texts.es: La Sra. Fatima Benigna  ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa Coopertaiva de servicios de ahorro y crédito “Coopestra” desempeñándose como Cajera  tiene  tres   años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha obtenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Fatima Benigna is employed by the “Coopestra” Savings and Loan Cooperative as a Cashier.  She’s been working for this firm for three years.  She’s currently married and has a school age son.  

She has had three CEPRODEL loans that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve her home.  Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for her in that they have helped improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and married.  She has 4 children – the oldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 18.  Catalina’s husband works as a farmer.

Catalina makes and sells “bahalina’ (coconut wine).  She has been running this business for 6 years.  Catalina works hard to help provide for their household needs and to send her children to school.  She requested a loan to buy more containers and other materials she needs for her business. 

She will also buy school supplies for her children.  In the future, Catalina hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more containers and school supplies

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita  is 21 years-old. She is married. In 2007, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 previous loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Ramita plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support. As a borrower, to improve living standards, extra training is needed. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther tiene 29 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Maria Esther se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos y semillas .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es tener dinero para educar a los hios.

Le gusta leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the San Jose Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of El Rosario, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Maria Esther is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Guzman Commercial Center in Ventanas and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. Maria Esther plans to buy composts and seeds. With the financial assistance, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that could impact her crops. Her dream is to have money for her children’s education.

Maria Esther enjoys reading and writing.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Edith has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. Edith sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Edith has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. 

She also generates additional income through tailoring. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have a wholesale shop. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica al comercio de mercería, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 32 años de edad, él inicio el negocio por necesidad, lo aprendió desde hace 16 años, sale a vender desde las 6:00am y regresa a las 6:00pm, o dependiendo de la zona que visite, porque viaja por distintos pueblos aledaños al lugar donde vive.
Actualmente comprara mercadería, prendedores, collares, artículos plásticos, para ofrecer a los clientes, esta inversión le ayudara para crecer con la mercadería.
Su propósito es velar por el sustento de su familia, trabajando diariamente para cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Juan works in haberdashery. He lives with his wife and son who is 32 years old. He started the business out of necessity, learned from 16 years ago. He goes out to sell at 6:00 a.m. and comes home at 6:00 p.m. depending on the area he is working in as he travels through to different towns in the area surrounding where he lives. 

Currently he will buy haberdashery items: pins, necklaces, plastic items to offer his customers. This investment will help him grow his inventory.

His purpose is to ensure the livelihood of his family, working daily to meet all the household needs.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items: pins, necklaces and plastic items.

loans.name: Man Investments Group

texts.en:
Morgan is 40 years old and lives in Masvingo.  He is a mechanic and employs three people.  He is married and has three children aged 6, 13 and 18, all attending school. Morgan also cares for one dependent.

The main issue that Morgan faces is a lack of capital with which to grow his business.  He will use the money he borrows to buy spare parts.

This loan will improve matters for this family because it will enable him to pay school fees. In the future, he wants to establish his own company.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 44 years old. He is from the village of Gantiadi, Tsalka District, South Georgia. Zaur is married and lives with his family: wife Gulnara, 17-year-old daughter, and 11-year-old son. His children go to school. Zaur leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have three milk cows. They sell the milk to local dairy wholesalers. He also has five calves. Zaur cultivates a 0.7 hectare plot of family-owned land, where he grows potatoes. He sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). The average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL (approximately 542 USD). 

Zaur requested credit for his farm. In particular, 200 GEL will be spent for harvesting potatoes (paying the workforce) and 800 GEL will be used to purchase hay for feeding cows and calves during the winter months. In the spring calves will be sold for a good price and provide income for the family. Harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding the cows and cover the costs of potato harvesting

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (pictured here), and her husband, Thuok, have been married since 1994 and have two daughters who are in school. The family lives on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhan now sells pickled fruit in her village. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetable. He hopes to continue his vegetable farming. Thus, Sokhan is applying for another loan of $200 to support her husband’s work by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to help supply her husband with the capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena de 37 años, esta casada con Alejandro de 43 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos habitan  en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Filomena, es una mujer consecuente en sus labores, desde muy pequeña aprendió a labrar la tierra, actividada que lo aprendió de sus queridos padres y hermanos. Cuando se comprometió con Juan, decidieron juntos comprar una parcela de cacao, con ello les generaría ingresos económico y poder ofrecer un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella para producir un producto de calidad se levanta muy temprano para luego enrumbar a su parcela agrícola donde pasara la mayor parte de su tiempo cuidando sus plantas de cacao en compañía de su esposo, quien siempre está al pendiente de su siembra. Filomena esta muy contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, ya que es un producto reconocido y bien posesionado por la calida que tiene. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar jornaleros para sacar la maleza de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Filomena is 37 years old and married to 43-year-old Alejandro.  They have seven children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.  Filomena is a woman who consistent in her work.  When she was very young, she learned to work the land, an activity that she learned from her beloved parents and siblings.  When she got engaged to Juan, they decided to jointly buy a plot of land for sowing cacao.  This would make them financial income and they would be able to offer their family a better life.  In order to produce a good-quality product, Filomina gets up very early and heads off to her plot of farmland where she spends most of her time caring for her cacao plants, together with her husband who is always looking after their crops.  Filomena is very happy with the work that she does as it makes her good financial income because her product is well-known and in good demand because of its quality.  

This is Filomena's second loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will invest the 2,000 soles she is requesting in hiring laborers to weed her cacao fields.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 3 children. Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Rose has a business in selling plastics. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Rose sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Rose has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more plastics for resale. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.  Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, ella cría y los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado de Calca, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, chanchos y gallinas al por mayor y también para comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, is a member of the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  She has a spouse and four children.

She alternates her daily chores with a business raising animals: she raises guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  She raises them and fattens them up and then sells them in the market in Calca.  She works from 9am until 4pm and through this business is able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the animal sales business so is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and chickens as well as feed for the animals.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and chickens at wholesale and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its ancient temples. She is a housewife. Her husband rents a small motor-driven boat to carry tourists to Baray Tek Thla to generate income to support the family. 

Pov has requested a loan of USD 1000 to buy a small motor-driven boat to rent to tourists at Baray Tek Thla.  In the future she would like to run a restaurant, build a new house and send her children to a good school. 

Note: This man is Pov's husband picture at home.

loans.use: to buy a small motor-driven boat to rent to tourists.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Хурсаной жительница района Пяндж. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она более шести лет занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для закупа коровы. Хурсаной хочет заняться животноводством.
texts.en: Khursanoy is a resident of the Pyandj district.  She is 45 years old, married and has one child.  She has been involved in agriculture for over six years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.  Khursanoy wants to get involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia extracts oil from palm kernels and sells it. She lives in Abrafo near Abura, and is divorced with three children. Efia has been doing this work for six years now. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase palm kernels from which she will extract oil to sell. With the profit that she makes, Efia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels so she can make oil to sell.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: Ubaldina tiene 41 años de edad es soltera con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella da pensión a los trabajadores civiles en su vivienda en horas de la mañana y en horas de la tarde vende comida rápida. Ella tiene como objetivo implementar su negocio con la venta de bebidas gaseosas y agua. El crédito lo invertira en la compra de mas pollos arroz y aceite. El grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Ubaldina es la que tiene a su bebe en brazos.Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Kiara en la parte superior izquierdo que no puedo estar presente en la reunion por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Ubaldina is 41 years old, and is single with three dependent children. She provides pre-ordered meals to civil servants from her house in the mornings, and in the afternoons she sells fast food. Her goal is to improve her business with the sale of soft drinks and water. She will use her loan to purchase soft drinks and water. 

The group “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loans they provide. Ubaldina is the one who has her baby in her arms.

loans.use: EN LA COMPRA DE MAS POLLO PAPA ARROZ Y ACEITE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
