Mr. Paulin A. was born in Tsévié on June 22, 1970. He is married and takes care of four children. When he gave up school, he studied to become a bricklayer. He had a difficult time finding work, so he began to sell gas on the side of the road. Because this was a fairly dangerous business, he decided to become a motorcycle taxi driver and has been one for quite some time now. His wife sells prepared beans and earns very little to help support their family.

Mr. A. is an energetic man with high moral standards who does all he can to meet his family's needs. To continue as a motorcycle taxi driver, he is requesting a loan of $1000, which will allow him to both buy his own motorcycle and pay for the registration fees. He could then increase his income and take better care of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 22 juin 1970 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Paulin est marié et a en charge quatre enfants. Abandonnant ses études, il se forme en maçonnerie. Ne trouvant pas de marché, il vend de l’essence au bord de la route. Compte tenu du risque de cette activité, il décida de conduire une moto taxi, ce qu’il fait il y a un bon moment. Sa femme revendeuse de haricot préparé, gagne très peu pour l’aider dans les charges de la famille.

Dynamique et de bonne moralité, il fait beaucoup d’effort pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour avoir sa propre moto, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’une part d’acheter la moto et d’autre part de faire les formalités pour l’immatriculation. Il pourra ainsi avoir plus de revenu et s’occuper plus de lui-même et de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for use as a taxi

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara has had her business for 1 year. “I have a small grocery store, but I need a lot more merchandise. I would like to buy more, but I don’t have the money to do it. It would be very helpful, in order to increase my income. My children and I live from the income from this business. I am requesting $1,000.00 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Sara tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año. “Tengo una tienda de abarrotes pero me falta mucha mercancía me,gustaría poder comprar más pero no tengo dinero para hacerlo me ayudaría mucho para que aumenten mis ingresos ya que de aquí del negocio es de donde vivimos mis hijos y yo. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio”.

loans.use: To invest in my business.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is the oldest of her siblings and ever since she was very little, she worked with her father where she sold cakes and pastries. Her father passed away while she was young, and to obtain the necessary resources to care for her siblings and mother, she continued with the business on her own. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, she succeeded in improving her family's lives, which fills her with lots of pride. Now Maricela is married and has a little six-year old boy. He has become her biggest reason to continue working hard.

Now Maricela is requesting a loan of $475 dollars that she will use to purchase ingredients that are needed to improve and increase her products. She hopes to be able to meet the demand from clients and give her business a boost. She promises to pay back this loan in six months. The assistance is needed today, and Maricela greatly appreciates the opportunity to continue with her business and make it grow. Become a part of her success. Support Maricela!

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Maricela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es la mayor de sus hermanos y desde muy pequeña trabajó en el puesto que tenia su padre donde vendía tortas, su padre falleció siendo ella joven y para obtener los recursos necesarios para la manutención sus hermanos y madre continuó con el negocio ella sola, gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo logró sacar adelante a su familia lo que la llena de orgullo, ahora Maricela está casada y tiene un pequeño de 6 años de edad, él se ha convertido en su motivo más grande para continuar trabajando.

Ahora Maricela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio, ella se compromete retornar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Maricela agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, forma parte de su logros ¡Apóyala!

loans.use: To buy the necessary resources to grow her pastry business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs Sim S. M. is a 25-year old mother of one child and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her farmland, growing rice crop and raising pigs, earning around $1.70 each day.  Her husband, meanwhile, works as a fisherman and generally generates about $ 7 per day. This couple has applied for a loan to purchase a boat and fishing net in order to facilitate their fishery business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing net for their fishery business.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en: Ramila is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in southeast part of Azerbaijan. She and her family were relocated to Lokbatan settlement of the city of Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She rents a booth in the local market and trades (sells) various household items. She has sold in the local market for more than 10 years. She wants to increase the volume of sales, invest more in her business and increase her income. She is applying for $1000 to invest in business.

loans.use: To increase working capital and increase items for sale

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.en:
Umidjon has been engaged in his current business for over two years. His business is the trade of coal.

His business place is located at his home in Spirtamen,Tadjklistan. He buys coal and raw materials from Krgyzstan. He purchases in sacks by tons. His turnover is quick and he has a lot of return, loyal customers. For the winter season, the price for coal is high so he wishes to obtain a loan from KIVA in order to purchase the biggest batch of his goods. He wishes to receive more profit during this time of holiday trade.

loans.use: To increase the volume of his goods.

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.es:
Geoconda makes mechanical pieces for trucks, industrial machines, and cars.

She began this business with her savings and economic support from her husband.

The initiative to have her own business began from unfortunate circumstances as she was unemployed and by helping her husband with the family income she used her savings to establish this business.

Today she has 9 years running this business located in a good spot in the capital city, Managua, and she has a steady clientele.

The financial support sought from Ceprodel has been used to provide improvements to the locale, such as providing lathes in good condition even though used.

Geoconda believes that she will continue to need financial support from Ceprodel so that her business can prosper and contribute to the family sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Geoconda se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de piezas mecánicas de camiones, maquinas industriales y automóviles .

Inicia su negocio con sus ahorros mas un aporte económico de su esposo.

La iniciativa de tener su propio negocio nace por infortunios del destino ya que queda en el desempleo y por ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar utiliza los fondos de su ahorro en el establecimiento de su negocio.

Actualmente tiene 9 años administrando su negocio encuentra ubicado en un buen punto de la ciudad capital, Managua, y tiene clientela fija.

Los aportes financieros que solicita en CEPRODEL los ha utilizado en brindar mejores condiciones a su local así como adquirir tornos en buen estado aunque sean usados.

La Sra. Geoconda considera que seguirá requiriendo del aporte financiero de CEPRODEL para que su negocio prospere y contribuir al sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four more bicycles and start a food kiosk for his wife

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny is a 27-year-old young mother who is responsible for educating and raising her four children. The only thing that sustains her household is the sale of flowers, which she cultivates and prepares creatively to transport and sell in the city of La Merced. Along with her dear husband, she is beginning to grow citrus, and in order to fully develop her crop she requires a sum of money as a capital investment. Jenny longs to see her land lush and full of fruit very soon and knows this only will be possible with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Jenny es una joven madre, que a sus 27 años tiene la responsabilidad de educar y cuidar a sus 4 hijos y con lo único que puede sostener su hogar es con la venta de flores que elabora creativamente que cultiva con el fin de trasladarlas a la ciudad de la merced y venderlas, además en compañía de su querido esposo está empezando a sembrar cítricos, y para el desarrollo pleno de esta última actividad requiere de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión.Jenny tiene el anhelo de poder ver muy pronto sus terrenos frondosos y llenos de frutos y sabe de esto sólo de concretará con su ayuda.

loans.use: Injection of capital to optimize the planting of citrus.

loans.name: Aurelia's Group

texts.es:
Odilia, Diana and Aurelia have belonged to the Ccori Soncco Communal Bank ("Heart of Gold") for two years, four months and seven years, respectively.

Odilia is 44 years old, married and has four children. She sells cheese at wholesale and retail at the local market. She purchases her products in the town of Alpachaca, where she also buys clothing, fruits and vegetables.

Diana is a 20-year-old single mother of one daughter. She makes traditional breads of the region in her parents' oven and sells it to stores.

Aurelia is 59 years old, married and has three children. She travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase cheese and small animals and sells them door to door in the city of Ayacucho.

Odilia, Diana and Aurelia need loans of 1000 soles ($400) apiece, which they will use to purchase cheese, gruits, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, lard and small animals.

Odilia, Diana and Aurelia dreams are to see their children be successful, enlarge their business and own a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Odilia, Diana y Aurelia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón de Oro” hace 2 años, 4 meses, 7 años respectivamente.

Odilia es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos, Odilia vende quesos al por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra en la comunidad de Alpachaca, donde vende ropa, frutas, verduras.

Por otro lado Diana es madre soltera, tiene 20 años y 1 hija, Diana elabora panes típicos de la zona, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus padres, sus productos los reparte a tiendas.

Mientras que Aurelia es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra queso, animales menores y lo vende caminando de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Odilia, Diana y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, frutas, azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina, manteca y animales menores.

Los sueños de Odilia, Diana y Aurelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio más grande y una panadería.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, gruits, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, lard and small animals / Odilia, Diana y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, frutas, azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina, manteca y animales menores.

loans.name: Amina's Zahanati Group

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 17. Amina owns a small stock of poultry, a business she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her poultry. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Victoria, who has a business in food sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her poultry

loans.name: Thi Sau

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Sáu is 38 years old. She's the group leader, everyone is requesting 2.006.000 VND. She has 2 children who still go to school. She raises silkworms and weaves silk. She likes SEDA program and wishes to remain with SEDA for a while.
- Mrs Chu Thị Hiền is 31 years old. She raises silkworms and weaves silk .
- Mrs Ngô Thị Du is 29 years old. She raises silkworms .
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Sữ is 55 years old. She needs the money to buy merchandise for her clothing store. .
- Mrs Chu Thị Thời is 33 years old. She needs the money to start a business: raise silkworms .

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Sáu (MS: 09050078), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị làm nghề sản xuất tơ tằm, chị có hai con đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi tằm và làm tơ. Chị rất thích vay trả góp và mong muốn tham gia chương trình lâu dài. Chị Chu Thị Hiền (MS: 09050079), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi tằm và làm tơ. Chị Ngô Thị Du (MS: 09050080), năm nay 29 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán tơ tằm. Cô Nguyễn Thị Sữ (MS: 09050081), năm nay 55 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy hàng quần áo bán. Chị Chu Thị Thời (MS: 09050082), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi tằm.

loans.use: raise silkworms

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 61 years old. He is married to Graciela Brítez, age 58, who helps him with the sales of his products. They live in their own house.

José emigrated to Argentinian lands at an early age where he learned to run a shoe store. Later, after 10 long and difficult years, he returned to his country deciding to invest his capital in starting his own shoe store.

They have two children who, thanks to the effort of their parents, have been able to complete their studies, being already professional and independent.

He needs the loan for the purchase of soles and forms for shoes. In this way he will be able to satisfy the demands of his clientele, since his work is very appreciated for the quality that he presents.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

José tiene 61 años de edad, está casado con Graciela Brítez de 58 años de edad, quien le ayuda en la venta de sus productos, viven en casa propia.

José emigró a tierras Argentinas a temprana edad donde aprendió el oficio de la zapatería, luego de 10 largos y sacrificados años regresó a su país decidiendo invertir su capital ahorrado en montar su propia zapatería.

Tienen dos hijos quienes gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres han podido culminar sus estudios, siendo ya profesionales e independientes.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de suelas y hormas para zapatos, de este modo podrá satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, ya que sus trabajos son muy apreciados por la calidad que presenta.

loans.use: To buy soles, forms and leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida is an enterprising and hardworking woman, who at 50 years old continues to work with all her energy for the future of her family, along with her husband, they work in the fields. One of their activities is to carefully select the seeds upon which their production will depend as they produce only native potatoes, as their land is located in a place where no other products can be grown. It is important that they sell their potatoes to agri-food businesses that adequately compensate their efforts. Adelaida and her husband also sell some animals that they raise on their land. Together they have raised 6 marvelous children, 4 of whom are grown with their own families, leaving the two youngest children, ages 13 and 11. Adelaida asks for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of organic and chemical fertilizer in order to improve their potato production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Adelaida es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, a sus 50 años sigue trabajando con todas las energías necesarias por el futuro D. su familia, junto a su esposo trabajan en las labores del campo, unas D. sus actividades es seleccionar cuidadosamente las semillas ya que D. ello depenD. la producción, ellos producen sólo papa nativa, ya que sus terrenos están ubicados en un lugar donD. no se pueD. cultivar otros productos, lo importante es que su papa la venden a empresas agroalimentarias que recompensan adecuadamente sus esfuerzos. Adelaida y su esposo también vender algunos animales que crían en su tierra.Juntos han criado a 6 maravillosos hijos, D. los cuales 4 D. ellos ya son personas que solventan a sus propias familias, ahora quedan en su poder dos pequeños D. 13 y 11 años.Adelaida solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra D. abono y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción D. papa.

loans.use: Purchase organic and chemical fertilizers for her potato crop

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: I. Abdumanon is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. Abdumanon is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs, including sweets, soft drinks, and juice, in the grocery store which he rents. Abdumanon is not alone in this business - his entire family actively helps him with the sales. Abdumanon has already previously received financial help through IMON. The financial assistance he has received has helped him expand his business. Currently, Abdumanon has about US$1,000 in inventory, while his gross income is about US$900 and his monthly net profit is about US$300. Abdumanon, however, needs a loan of US$1,075 for a term of 8 months to be able to increase the stock of goods in his store. He is ready to work hard and make sacrifices to become an even more successful entrepreneur. Abdumanon's perseverance and clear vision, too, will help him succeed in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago González es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Monte Alto, esta casado con la señora Carmen Bonifacia Portillo, tienen casa propia, con 2 hijos, ya mayores de edad que trabajan en forma independiente.

 Tienen un Hospedaje en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, tiene buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales. La mayoría de los clientes que van a su hospedaje son extranjeros que visitan la ciudad.

El señor Santiago es muy trabajador y muy conocido por la zona de Santani, su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 27 años.

      Quiere construir otro hospedaje en otra zona céntrica de la ciudad, es por ello que está solicitando el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago González is from the city of San Estanislao, Monte Alto neighborhood, he’s married to Mrs. Carmen Bonifacia Portillo, they have their own home, and two grown children who work and are independent. They have a hostel (provide lodging) in their home, with a steady clientele, they have good income, good commercial and personal references. The majority of their guests are foreigners visiting their city. Santiago is hard working and well known in the Santani area, he has had this business for 27 years. He wants to construct another lodging in another central zone of the city, and that is why he is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of lodging

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M., tiene la edad de 58 años de edad habita en el barrio Esquí pula ubicado cerca de la iglesia católica, esta señora es soltera no tiene hijos pero tiene a su cargo a su papá y a un sobrino que su hermana le dejo a su cargo ya que falleció hace mucho tiempo, el joven de 14 años  después que llega de clases le ayuda con el negocio ya que ella le entrega y vende comida desde hace cinco años , los sueños de esta señora es llegar a tener un comedor . Ella solicita la cantidad de  C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar  más insumos y granos básicos, ya que ahora la buscaron para entregar comida a la iglesia de Ticuantepe al personal que labora en la tienda, y ella no cuenta con muchos recursos para poder cumplir con sus encargos.
texts.en:
Señora Nelsa Abigail M. is 58 years of age and lives in the neighborhood Esquípula located near the catholic church. This lady is single and does not have any children, but she is in charge of caring for her father and a nephew who her sister left to her when she passed away a long time ago. The young boy is fourteen years old. After he arrives home from classes, he helps her with the business. She has been delivering and selling food for five years now. This lady's dream is to someday have a dining room for her business. She is requesting a loan for the quantity of C$ 6,000 (Córdobas, the currency of Nicaragua) to buy more ingredients and basic grains; now people have come to her to request food deliveries to the church of Ticuantepe for the people working in the store, and she does not currently work with the resources to be able to fulfill these orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy primary ingredients and invest in her food business.

loans.name: Diame Actions Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diamé Actions est spécialisé dans l'offre de services : traitement de texte, reliure,photocopies. Il participe activement à l'insertion et à l'initiation des jeunes aux NTIC.
Ils sollicitent ce prêt pour acheter des rames de papiers et des consommables informatiques. Ce qui leurs permettra d'augmenter leur bénéfice.
texts.en:
The group Diamé Actions is specialized in offering these services: word-processing, book-binding, and photocopying. The group actively participates in the integration and initiation of the young into computers and telecommunications technologies. The members of the group are requesting this loan to buy reams of paper and computer-related consumables. This will enable them to increase their profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Word-processing and photocopying

loans.name: Victory

texts.en:
Victory I. is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a police officer. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: La Sra. H. es soltera, de 39 años de edad, auxiliar de enfermeria, trabajadora del Hospital Asuncion con 23 años de servicio, tiene 2 hijos, un varon estudiando 3er año de zootecnia en la Universidad Agraria y la niña en 4to grado de primaria.  Doña Candelaria plantea que vivio durante 18 años alquilando y fue hasta finales del año 2008 que pudo realizar su suelo  de tener una vivienda propia, la que obtuvo a traves de Cáritas donde pagó U$.1,000.00 dólares, ella tenia el terreno que compro con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado. En esta ocacion esta solicitando su 6to credito el que utilizara para construir un pequeño anexo para cocina, instalar energia electrica, agua y construccion de una letrina, con lo que dará una mayor comodidad a su vivienda, una vez realizado el proyecto que se ha planteado tendra la posiblidad de trasladarse a vivir en lo que es propio, sueño que se realizo despues de mucho tiempo y con el apoyo que le brindó AFODENIC, ahora puede ofrecer a sus hijos un techo aunque pequeño pero digno y lo mejor que es propio.  Ella tiene el apoyo de su hijo que realiza algunas activivdades en el tiempo que no esta en clase, donde el dinero que percibe lo comparte con ella.  Manifiesta que le pide a Dios siempro cumplir con sus compromisos crediticios, pues siempre se necesita qeue le sirvan con confianza.
texts.en:
Señora H. is single, 39, and a nursing assistant. She has 23 years of service at Hospital Asunción. She has two children, a son who is in his third year of studying zoology at the agricultural university, and a daughter who is in fourth grade. Candelaria considers that she rented a place to live for 18 years, and at the end of 2008, she thought she earned enough money to realize her dream of having her own home. She acquired her home through Cáritas, where she paid $1,000. She had the land that she purchased with her credits that AFODENIC offered her. On this occasion, she is requesting her sixth credit, which she will use to build a small addition to her kitchen, to install electricity and water, and to construct a bathroom, which will give her home more comfort. At the same time, she will accomplish the project that she set out to achieve and will have the possibility of moving into her own home, a dream that she has has for a long time. With the support of AFODENIC, she can now offer her children their own roof to sleep under. Although it is small, it is worthy and it's better because it's their own. She has the support of her son, who makes money while he is not in class and shares with her. She expresses that she always asks God to let her comply with her credit obligations because it is always necessary to serve him with confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct an addition to her kitchen and a bathroom

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en: M. Ibrahim is the leader of the loan group, Biva Muntuuyo, based in Lugazi. He is married and has six children.  He has a tailoring business that he has been operating for eleven years. His workshop produces both casual and formal suits for men. He is well known for the services he renders and this wins him more loyal customers. To fulfill his customer's orders, he enlists the help of his brother and two other workers.  Currently, he owns three sewing machines.  He is requesting a loan to buy more materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra S. has a business selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Nasra is 25 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Nasra hopes to reinvest in her business


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: Expand her business selling beer

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
K. Annet is the leader of the Konoweka group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working lady with a retail shop as her business. In fact, out of the six members in the group, four have retail shops as their main businesses in addition to farming for food production.

In her shop, Annet sells mostly the basics like sugar, bread, eggs, cooking oil and paraffin. She buys her goods from Zziba's wholesale shops as well as from Lugazi town. She needs a loan to help with restocking her retail shop so that she can be able to make more profits to cater for her family.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 36 years old and married with six children. Her oldest daughter is 22, while her youngest son is just 14 months old (pictured).

Maria sells electronics on the street in the town of Anta, about forty minutes outside the city of Cusco. She sells mostly radios, stereos, TVs, cameras, and flashlights, as well as small household appliances like blenders. She has been in this line of work for the past two years. Maria works seven days a week, from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. She usually sells about 300-800 soles (US $95-$254) of merchandise each day, of which about 20% is profit. Maria’s husband runs a photo services store in Anta, and her oldest daughter has a photo services / call center locale in the capital city of Lima, about twenty hours from Anta.

Maria is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more small electronics to sell. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal for the future is to expand her husband’s business and open stores in Quillabamba and Abancay, two major cities within eight hours of Anta.

loans.use: To buy more small electronics to sell

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “siempre amigas” pertenece al centro focal Panamericana, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy responsables en todas sus actividades de grupo.
Casi todas casadas, con familias numerosas nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares sobrepasan al ingreso que obtienen en sus negocios ya que sus familias son numerosas y sus  hijos van creciendo aumentando sus necesidades.
La mayor parte del grupo se dedica a  comercio de productos variados, venta que la realizan en puestos fijos y también de  forma ambulante, por ejemplo venden abarrotes,  queso, verduras, productos de limpieza, también se dedican al tejido de mantas . Ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas para esto necesitan capital para poder comprar productos en mayor cantidad. De esta manera  mejorarían sus ingresos y su estabilidad económica en sus hogares
texts.en:
The "friends forever" association belongs to the Pan-American center. With the help of it's loan officer, the group is very responsible in all of its activities. Nearly all of the group members are married, and many have families. Most of the daily costs of running a home exceed the income earned from their businesses, as the group members have many children with growing needs. Most group members sell various products from their stores and also on the street. For example, some sell groceries, cheese, vegetables, and cleaning products. They also weave blankets. The members would like to improve their sales and therefore need capital to buy supplies wholesale. In this way they'll improve their income and the economic stability of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need to buy products

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.en:
Tạ Thị N. is a 29 year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is primarily from providing repair services to local community members. N. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years. She earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services so she could improve her living situation through her business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by N. from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Hardworking and industrious Leonida S. is 54 years-old and married, presently living at Clarin in Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines.  She recently joined Paglaum to access financial assistance for her "sari-sari" store, or mini market, to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to help her husband provide for their family.  She hopes one day to have a successful business with a concrete store and for her children to finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: To but more products for her mini market.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Нуринисо удачно закончила кредит и хочет получить повторный, на закуп летних спортивных маек и шорт.Она ланирует получив кредит съездить в Истаравшан.
texts.en:
Nuriniso successfully completed her loan and wants to receive a second one. She will use the loan to purchase sporty summer tank tops and shorts. She plans to receive a loan to travel to Istaravshan. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is from the village of Danao. She is 47 years old, is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a fishing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Grace is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP,  which she will use to expand the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort L. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells electronic parts. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more electronic parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic parts to sell

loans.name: Akbarshoh

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide education to his four dear children is the reason Akbarshoh is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hardworking father who for many years was dedicated to the business of buying and selling shoes. With the income, he said he was able to educate his children as it is most important for Akbarshoh. Today he is requesting a loan of $800 USD to expand the business so that he can generate more income for the well-being of his family. Akbarshoh is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new shoes to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia, es natural de Andahuaylas, Apurimac, ella actualmente reside en  la provincia de Urubamba en el famoso barrio de pisonayniyoc.

Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la panadería y la artesanía, ella trabaja en la calle comercio 231, ella requiere el préstamo para uso personal, pero una parte desea invertir en la compra de algunos materiales para realizar sus trabajos de forma artesanal.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, de modo tal que se compromete a cumplir con el cronograma de pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Lucia, is a native of Andahuaylas, Apurimac. She is currently a resident of the Province of Urubamba in the famous neighborhood of Pisonayniyoc.

Our member is 26 years old and is a single mother. She alternates her household duties with a bakery and a handicraft workshop. She works on the commercial street 231. She needs a loan for personal use, but in part wants to invest in buying some materials to carry out her handicraft work.

Our member is very grateful for the loan granted through this process and so she agrees to comply with the payment schedule on the specified dates.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal is a 37-year-old married man living with his child. Twenty years ago he started waxing and painting cars. In 1995, after learning the business he decided to open his own store where he performs paint jobs for cars. Today, Jalal is hoping to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Âgé de  38 ans, Zoumana Koné est marié à deux  épouses, père de 2 enfants, il vit dans une famille  polygame dans l’un des quartiers populaire de Koutiala Sogomougou  ( Région de Sikasso ).  
Du à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est accroché aux activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge, qu’il apprit  auprès de son feu père jadis commerçant. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et sa notoriété dépasse les limites de la seule ville de Koutiala.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Monsieur  Zoumana  a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a 2 ans.  IL est à son  troisième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les précédents.  
Ce prêt servira a acquérir divers stocks de marchandises. Il s’approvisionne au près  des grossistes  de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique au quartier Sogomougou de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes au comptant., en détail et à crédit.  
Avec l’élargissement de son activité, Monsieur compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. IL envisage rembourser ce prêt correctement pour qu’il puisse bénéficier un autre dans le but d’élargir son activité.

loans.use: Achat de diverses marchandises.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une revendeuse ambulante de casseroles, de plats ou du verre à boire. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle vend de maison en maison et dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle et qui préfère les plats ou casseroles à la mode. Elle a de grandes ambitions pour l’avenir et prévoit ouvrir une boutique de vente de ces articles. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner au Grand Marché de Lomé ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de différents plats, casseroles et verres à boire sur commande.

loans.use: Achat de casseroles, plats et verres à boire

loans.name: Elsa Dinora

texts.es: Elsa Dinora N. A. de 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla del departamento de La Libertad, Elsa se dedica a su negocio donde fabrica grandes cantidades  de quesadillas, ella recibe ayuda de Carlos su esposo, quien cada mañana está al pendiente del horno en el cual se están cocinando las quesadillas, las que luego Carlos y su esposa empiezan a empacar y colocar en una canasta térmica para guardar el calor, luego Carlos sale del negocio con su canasta montada en una bicicleta, para comenzar su largo recorrido donde vende todas sus quesadillas. El crédito que solicita Elsa es para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para su producción de quesadillas.
texts.en:
Elsa Dinora N. A. is 20 years old and lives in the city of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Her business involves producing large quantities of quesadillas*. She has the support and assistance of her husband Carlos. Every morning, Elsa is stationed at her oven baking quesadillas. The cakes are packaged and stored in a basket to keep them warm. Carlos mounts the basket onto his bicycle and travels around until all the quesadillas are sold.

The loan Elsa is requesting will be used to purchase ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her production of quesadillas.

(*Unlike the Mexican snack of the same name, the Salvadoran quesadilla is a rich, sweet dessert cake often found in local bakeries. The “queso” in quesadilla is traditionally unsalted Salvadoran queso fresco, a fresh farmers-type cheese.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye S. est une femme de 40 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 18 janvier 2001. Elle fait du commerce de bananes, elle achète son produit en gros et revend au détail dans son quartier. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye S. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since January 18, 2001. She does commerce in bananas. She buys her product wholesale and sells at the retail level in her area. Her profits allow her to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business selling bananas

loans.name: Vilma Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Lisseth L. L. de 43 años desde hace dieciocho años que comercializa de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos, prenda y cosmético. Ella asegura que se siente con mayor libertad, con capacidad y segura de sí misma, ya que aporta a la casa  y  es independiente.
Ella invertirá su crédito para adquirir mercadería en ropa, zapatos, prendas y cosméticos, además de aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma Lisseth L. Lopez is 43 years old. She has been selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics for eighteen years. Her work allows her to feel free and secure-- and confident that she is contributing to her household. Vilma will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, including more clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She will also use a little to help her celebrate the Holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing, shoes and cosmetics and jewellery

loans.name: Siempre Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Siempre Unidas" esta representada por la señora Reinalda y conformada por 14 miembros que ya van ingresando a un tercer ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos así como capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados. Cada una D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, computadoras, Tarjetas y al servicio D. albañilería. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su M. laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayuD. a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias tropezaron con algunas malas socias en el grupo anterior pero supieron salir adelante y cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos trabajando en equipo y D. forma unida, mejorando cada día mas su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Unidas" group, led by Reinalda, is maD. up of 14 members who are starting their third cycle having demonstrated honesty and responsiblility in their repayments as well as capacity to administer the funds received. The members are in different lines of commerce such as, sale of prepared meals, cosmetics, grocery stores, computer services, phone cards, and masonry. They are conscious that what makes the difference between one group and another is the care one gives to customers so that they will become return customers and faithful to the products offered by the members. This is why they don't have much competition. The new financing will be used to buy merchandise, raw materials and tools that will help them generate better earnings in order to proviD. their families with better living conditions. As for their credit history, they ran into some underperforming members in their previous group but they managed to forge ahead anyway and make their repayments in a timely fashion working as a cohesive unit and daily improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario tiene 53 años esta casado con Enedina de 47 años y juntos tienen 5 hijos, pero sólo viven con 2 de ellos, Joseline de 17 y Sharon de 6 años, en su casa propia fabricada de adobe (adoquines de barro), paja y tejas. Desde hace 26 años y con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la agricultura de papa, maíz, alverja, productos agrícolas de la sierra peruana, así como también cultiva verduras y flores en variedad. Es así que esta humilde pareja empieza su jornada laboral desde las 4 de la madrugada para regar sus cultivos, luego regresan a su domicilio a preparar el alimento de sus hijas para que vayan a estudiar, posteriormente regresan al trabajo hasta que caiga la noche. Según Hilario, nos comenta que muchas veces él y su esposa no regresan a casa y aprovechan la noche para continuar con el trabajo y pese a las variaciones climáticas hacen del trabajo mas sacrificado. Al final tiene su recompensa, ya que le resulta gratificante la cosecha, ya que obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le ayudan a la manutención de su familia.  Para Hilario la agricultura significa toda su vida, ya que aprendió desde muy pequeño y le sirvió para sacar adelante a su familia, por tal motivo espera mas adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad, y paralelo a ello dedicarse a la crianza de ovinos, porcinos y tener 3 cabezas de ganado para luego comercializarlos a buen precio. Siendo un hombre que desea mejorar, solicita un crédito con MFP, esta es su octavo crédito y lo más importante para él es seguir trabajando con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita desea comprar varios porcinos para engordarlos y en el futuro tener una granja para así vender la carne de porcinos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad ya que tiene gran demanda de los compradores.
texts.en:
Hilario is 53, and he is married to Enedina who is 47. They have five children, but only two of them live with them. Joselina is 17, and Sharon is 6. They live in their own house, which is made from adobe (clay cobblestones), straw, and tile. For 26 years, with help from his wife, he has been growing potatoes, corn, and peas. These are agricultural products from the Peruvian mountain range. He also grows vegetables and a variety of flowers. This humble couple starts their day’s work at four in the morning in order to water their crops. They then return home to prepare food for their daughters to go to school. They later return to work until nightfall. According to Hilario, there are many times that he and his wife do not return home, and they take advantage of the night to continue working. Due to the climate changes, they do the most self-sacrificing work. At the end, they have their recompense because the harvest is gratifying. They get good earnings, which helps support their family. To Hilario, agriculture represents his whole life. He learned to farm when he was very small, and it has served him to get his family ahead. That is why he hopes to later plant a larger quantity. At the same time, he raises sheep, pigs, and three heads of cattle to later sell at a good price. Being a man who wishes to improve, he is asking for a loan with MFP. This is his eighth loan. The most important thing to him is to keep working with his colleagues in his communal bank. He wishes to use the loan to buy various pigs to fatten. In the future he wants to have a farm in order to sell pork in the wholesale market in his city. There is a great buyers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Flor es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas al por mayor y menor, para lo cual tiene 2 personas que le apoyan. Además Flor vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y cosméticos.
Flor sueña con construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccatarisum”, which means “Let’s Rise” in Quecha. She is 34 years old, single, and has two children. Flor has a store in her home where she sells beverages wholesale and retail. She has two people who assist her. In addition, Flor sells cosmetics from catalogs.

She needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to buy beer and cosmetics. Flor dreams of building a house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & cosmetics

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en:
Urbana R., from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur, is 45, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Urbana owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as candies, coffee, milo, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Urbana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Urbana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, Urbana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This loan will her fourth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Emaculatha

texts.en:
Emaculatha E. is a married woman and a business entrepreneur. She runs a business selling cooking oil to customers at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam.

Emaculatha purchases her business goods from the wholesale suppliers and sells retail to consumers. She also prepares and sells bites (bread-like rolls).

The business income derived helps Emaculatha to pay the house rent, meet daily family needs, and expand her business. She needs a loan of TZS 600,000 to buy more cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Amigos De Caliri Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento AMIGOS DE CALIRI se formo en la zona de Caliri a orillas del rio Irpavi, en su mayoria sus habitantes se dedican al lavado de arena, aunque tambien se dedican a otras actividades para lo cual deben de salir muy temprano a sus fuentes de trabajo puesto que el transporte es muy escaso en la zona. la asociacion esta compuesta por 8 socios de los cuales forman parte de la mesa directiva.

la Srta Maria quien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, ella es estudiante en la universidad y su deseo es terminar su carreara y a si poder mejorar su calidad de vida, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia por promocion para luego venderlos al precio original.

El Sr. Sandalio quien trabaja en construcciones, esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar, el dinero del credito lo invertira en la compra de material de construccion y herramientas para utilizarlas en su trabajo.

El Sr. Edwin  que se dedica a la venta de muebles en la feria de 16 de julio, esta casado y su esposa le ayuda en la venta de muebles, con el dinero del credito comprara  mercaderia y asi tener mayor cantidad de muebles para la venta.

Forman la asociacion tambien: Jesus que es albañil, Ines que se dedica a a la venta de cosmeticos, Ximena vende celulares, Maria Isabel  se dedica a la costura de ropa y la Sra Remedios se dedica al lavado de arena en el rio irpavi. el prestamo solicitado servira al incremento de capital de trabajo y asi mejorar sus negocios. Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Amigos de Caliri (Friends of Caliri) Bank was formed in the Caliri region on the shore of the Irpavi River. The majority of its population works in the sandblasting business, although they also work in other areas, meaning they must leave for their places of employment very early as transportation is very scarce in their area. The group is formed of 8 members who form part of the board of directors.

Mrs. Maria works selling cosmetics through a catalog. She is a student at the univsersity and her desire is to graduate and be able to improve her quality of life. With the loan, she will buy merchandise on sale to later sell for the original price.

Mr. Sandalio works in construction. He is married and has small school-aged children. He will invest the loan money in the purchase of construction materials and tools to use in his job.

Mr. Edwin works selling furniture at the 16 de Julio market. He is married and his wife helps him sell furniture. With the loan money, he will buy merchandise to have more furniture for sale.

Other group members include: Jesus, who is a mason, Ines, who works selling cosmetics, Ximena, who sells cell phones, Maria Isabel, who is a seamstress, and Mrs. Remedios, who does sandblasting at the Irpavi River. The loan will be used to increase labor capital to improve their businesses. All of the members are thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting them with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and merchandise

loans.name: Silvio Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Silvio es un pequeño agricultor y ganadero de este municipio donde gracias a los prestamos que ha obtenido con ceprodel ha logrado salir adelante en su hogar lo que le ha permitido mejorar la casa además de aumentar su hato ganadero con el fin de producir más leche la cual el ordeña las vacas y vende la leche o produce cuajada.
Este crédito es para financiarle la compra de vaquillas preñadas con el fin de mejorar su ganado y aumentarlo
texts.en:
Silvio is a small-scale crop and livestock farmer in this town, where the loans he's received from Ceprodel have helped him get ahead. He's improved his home and expanded his herd in order to produce more milk. He milks the cows and sells the milk or makes curd. This loan will finance the purchase of inseminated cows in order to improve and expand his herd.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inseminated cows

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
O. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children.

O. sells rechargeable phone cards wholesale to her customers. She has been in this business for some years now and has been doing well. She is focused on making sure she meets the demands of her customers which she said will also lead to an increase in profit-making.

O. is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and earn more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back at the due date and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards in bulk

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 39 years old. She is married and is mother to 6 adorable children. Saodat has a grocery store which she attends to herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She began her business 7 years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income. The business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests for a loan of $3000 US Dollars. Saodat is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of inventory. She promises to repay her loan on time and thanks everybody who decide to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the goods for selling to increase the range of inventory.

loans.name: Los Plata Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los P. está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, escosadas y decididas provenientes de Piedra Quemada una comarca de Nindirí, zona rural de difícil acceso. La coordinadora del grupo es María Lourdes S. P. de 26 años de edad quien desde pequeña trabaja junto con su madre en la venta de candelas y veladoras. 
 
Ella actualmente administra el negocio y con el préstamo piensa comprar  nuevos productos y candelas para su negocio. Esta joven  es madre de dos pequeños, trabaja, administra su propio negocio y estudia contabilidad.

Sus compañeros de grupo son  la señora Olga María B. P. de 65 años de edad quien se dedica al lavado y planchado de ropa además de vender algunos objetos y  Reynaldo José P. S. de 69 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ganado.
texts.en:
The Los P. group is comprised of three hard-working and determined people who put forth a lot of effort. They are from Piedra Quemada in the Nindirí district, which is a rural area with difficult access. María Lourdes S. P., age 26, is the coordinator of the group. Since she was little she has worked with her mother selling candles. She currently runs the business. She plans to use the loan to buy new products and candles for the business. This young woman has two children, works, runs her own business, and is studying accounting. Olga María B. P., age 65, is a colleague in the group. She washes and irons clothes. She also sells some objects. Reynaldo José P. S., age 69, is the other colleague in the group. He is in the livestock business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candles

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 45 years old. She is married with five children, ages 18 to 30 years old. Two of the children are attending school.

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya where she has been farming for 15 years. Her products are milk, maize and tea which she sells to the local market and Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also buys and sells maize at the local market. Her main challenges are the poor transport network and lack of finances to do business at a higher level.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Through this loan she will be able to acquire a dairy cow that will increase her security and this will enable her access to bigger loans in the future. The extra income from this loan will enable her to educate and feed her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo for their loan and hopes to get more support in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 10.15.04 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Thuy T. B. is a 48 year old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thuy is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04-Dong Son (10.15.04).

Thuy is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thuy owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Thuy has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 21,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Thuy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  T. T. Han (4) is a 63 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  LeT. Hue (9) is a 26 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.
3.  D. T. Thuy (10) is a 37 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.
4.  P. T. B. Hue (34) is a 33 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.
5.  P. T. Thien (23) is a 58 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
6.  L. T. Van (18) is a 59 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
7.  N. T. Thinh (35) is a 54 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.
8.  L. T. Nhan (11) is a 43 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuy T. B. (2) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thuy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04-Dong Son (10.15.04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuy kiếm được khoảng 21000000 VND.  Vào 2004, Thuy đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Han (4) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  LeT. Hue (9) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  D. T. Thuy (10) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  P. T. B. Hue (34) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  P. T. Thien (23) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  L. T. Van (18) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  N. T. Thinh (35) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


8.  L. T. Nhan (11) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina I. is 46, married, and has one child who is three years old.  She is starting a business venture in which she will plant and harvest taro for sale.  Tina needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or $188 USD per week) to improve her business.

In 2010, Tina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Tina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD :
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar R., a 33-year-old married mother of two children, has been selling oriental-style plates and dishes for 15 years. In high demand, this kind of china is widely used for girls' dowries and for family celebrations. Now Sanobar is planning to enlarge her range of goods and purchase china in the neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan and is therefore requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni. An active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006, her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. The well-being of Sanobar’s family and her business are in your hands. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase oriental style plates and dishes to increase her range of goods for sale

loans.name: Ratna Keshari

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Ratna keshari S.. She is married and has two children aged 19 and 17. In 2006, she established her small restaurant business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supoorts her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW which she used to buy cooking materials. In the future, Ratna keshari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a BPW loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

This loan was administered by BPW's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Evelin Mercedes

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 49 años.  Mercedes nació y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos.  
 
Mercedes es licenciada en Administración de Empresas. Actualmente, Mercedes trabaja como empleada publica en la universidad san Antonio Abad del Cusco en el área de administración de obras. Mercedes y su amiga Amelia abrieron una pequeña empresa de servicios de Katherine. Ya es un  año que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un samovar. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member, Mercedes, 49, belongs to the communal bank "Granito de Mostaza", part of the Arariwa Association. Mercedes was born and lives in Cusco city together with her husband and 3 children. Mercedes is qualified in Business Administration and works as a public employee at the San Antonio Abad University of Cusco in project administration. Mercedes and her friend Amelia opened a small service business called Katherine. She has run this business for a year and it is doing very well thanks to the hard work that she puts in. Mercedes is seeking a loan to purchase a samovar. Mercedes is very thankful for the opportunity given to her and promises to meet the repayments according to the timeline stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a samovar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia D. is from the village of Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to invest in expanding her business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to again invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from ASKI.
