She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of intrants for making local soap

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “VICUÑITAS” es una asociación que está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada quince días, para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas, permitiéndoles  conocerse mejor.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Maura como presidenta, la señora Maria como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Griselda.

La señora  Maura es una mujer de 27 años de edad, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar que las integrantes de la mesa directiva y los grupos solidarios cumplan con sus funciones de manera adecuada.   Ella ingresó a la asociación gracias a la invitación de una amiga.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende dulces de forma ambulante, repartiendo a las tiendas y puestos de  los colegios.  Inicio este negocio con un pequeño capital hace seis años, aprendió el negocio de unos familiares que tienen el mismo negocio.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados: venta de conservas, costura de polar, artesanìa en mantas, salon de Belleza, venta de ropa usada, ventas de  mantas, artesanìa en yeso, venta de papas fritas y chicharrones, venta de dulces.
texts.en:
The “VICUÑITAS” cooperative group is an association located in downtown Collpani, and is requesting a loan for the first time.  It is comprised of ten members.  The women meet every fifteen days to train and pay their loan installments, which also allows them to get to know each other better.  The management board is made up of Maura, president, Maria, treasurer, and Griselda, who serves as the secretary.

Maura is 27 years old and, as president of the group, has the task of ensuring that the management board and independent groups are carrying out their functions properly.  She joined the association thanks to a friend’s invitation.  With respect to her business, she works as a street vendor selling candy, distributing her products to stores and schools.  She started her enterprise six years ago with a small amount of capital, having learned the trade from a relative who has the same type of business.

With respect to the other members’ businesses, they are varied:  selling preserves, sewing pullovers, handcrafting blankets, a beauty parlor, selling used clothing, selling blankets, plaster handicrafts, selling French fries and chicharrones, and candy sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (candies).

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber would like a loan to buy trousers, shirts, dresses and clothing materials for suits for reselling. He is married man and a tailor with one child. He lives in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of expanding his business by acquiring more sewing machines and more clothing materials for a big shop for big business.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, shirts, dresses and clothing materials for suits for reselling.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. is a widow taking care of seven dependants. Araba sells foodstuffs such as canned tomatoes, okra, onions, pepper and other items at Elmina. Araba uses her income to see to the welfare of her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to educate her dependants.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis  M. G. es un exitoso microempresario de la Palma de puerto Jimenez. Su negocio es una  Pulpería(tienda general) llamada “Monterrey”.
El tiene 2 años de haber iniciado su negocio, y asegura que  ha sido todo un éxito, pero ya es hora de dar un paso adelante como micro empresario. Es por eso que Don Luis desea un préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de mas producto  que le permita ampliar y mejorar su negocio.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Raíces Capitales, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en:
Luis  M. G. is a successful small businessowner from La Palma in Puerto Jimenez. His business is a general store called "Monterrey". 

He started the business 2 years ago, and says it has been a complete success, but now it is time to take the next step as a businessman. Don Luis is therefore seeking a loan of 400,000 colones for the purchase of more products, that will permit him to enlarge and improve his business. 

He is a member of the Raíces Capitales communal bank, one of over 100 such organisations associated with [the field partner] EDESA.

loans.use: To buy groceries and cleaning products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in the Mengo kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and brother). Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills. 

Joyce owns and operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products at retail prices in her shop. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Wiñay Huayna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY HUAYNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 54 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la venta D. bebidas como chicha D. quinua, agua D. manzana y chicha morada, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado D. Wanchaq que trabaja desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio D. este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere tener un snack donD. pueda vender las bebidas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las bebidas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. ropa, venta D. artesanía, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. carteras y venta D. tejidos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the “WIÑAY HUAYNA” cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Cusco.

The member is Rosa, who is 54 years old, single, and has one child.  She dedicates herself to selling beverages such as chicha D. quinua, apple juice, and chicha morada (chicha is a traditional Andean beverage, typically derived from maize).  

She has a site at the market in Wanchaq, where she works from 10:00 am until 5:00 pm.  By means of this small business, she helps her son get ahead.  She would like to have a snack stand where she could sell the beverages.  She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients for making her refreshments.

The other members dedicate themselves to selling clothing, handicrafts, handbags, and knitted goods, and some have general stores.

She is happy about the loan, and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making her beverages.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de  El Alto, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Pedro es jubilado rentista y a la vez trabaja en una pensión  y su esposa es ama de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen; con un anterior crédito realizó la refacción del baño de su casa. Ahora requiere un nuevo crédito para la construcción de un garage en su casa. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own home in the district of Villa Exaltacion within the city of El Alto. He is married and he has three children. Pedro is retired and he lives from his investments and his pension. His wife is a housewife. They support themselves through these two incomes.  With a past loan he carried out renovations to a bathroom in his home.  He requests a new loan to build a garage for his house. He is very happy with the loans he has received. 

His previous history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To build a garage for his home.

loans.name: La Lucha Sigue Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Lucha Sigue consigna que siempre han tenido presente estas tres féminas ejemplares. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Fátima Venega se dedica al comercio de productos Avon marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. Ella con el crédito comprara perfumes, cosméticos y tratamientos que han encargado.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Angela S. quien vende pollo y queso y Rosalba L. quien vende tortillas.
texts.en:
The La Lucha Sigue [The Struggle Continues] group states that it has always had these three exemplary women. The group coordinator is Mrs.  Fátima Venega. She sells Avon products, a brand known for catalogue sales. With the loan, she will buy perfumes, cosmetics and treatments that have been ordered from her.  

The other members of the group are Angela S., who sells chicken and cheese, and Rosalba L., who sells tortillas.

loans.use: Avon products

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor

texts.es:
Guillermo de 45 años, es vendedor de pescado porque desde pequeño empezó a trabajar en el mercado de caraguay (mercado de mariscos). Poco a poco incremento sus ventas ya que se independizo. 

En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su esposa desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Vende pescados llamados albacoras, picudo, corvina la libra aproximada desde $ 2.50. Uno de los inconvenientes al realizar su trabajo es vende en la calle ya que es comerciante ambulante y en ocasiones tiene problemas con los metropolitanos. 

En el futuro tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio pero por ahora quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción para su vivienda como cemento, arena, bloques. Y asi darle un buen futuro a sus hijos (aparecen en la foto).
texts.en:
Guillermo is 45 years old and, from a very early age, has been selling fish at the market in Caraguay (seafood market).  He was able to increase sales and gradually became independent.

With the help of his wife he now works from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon every day.  He sells tuna, picudo fish, and sea bass for approximately $2.50 a pound.  One of the inconveniences of his job is that he sells in the streets and sometimes runs into difficulties in the metropolitan areas.

He hopes to be able to increase his business in the future but for now wants to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks for his home.  In this way he can provide a better future for his sons (shown in the photo).

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and bricks

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband Ferdinand, who is 45 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 4 to 23 years old. Angie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Angie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Angie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Kweyamba

texts.en: Kweyamba F. is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 30 years old and married with two children. F. is a salary earner and he needs a loan to be able to clear his child's school fees and pay his labourer to work on the farm. F. is also involved in agriculture and he employs one laborer to help with the farm on days when he goes to work. He is happy that his wife is there to help out. He will use his salary to pay back the loan as the proceeds from his farm will help him grow and develop more.

loans.use: Clearing his child's school fees and paying his labourer to work on the farm

loans.name: Laure's Group

texts.en:
Laure, Prisca, and Berthe are sisters-in-law and good friends, and have agreed to support each other through business and loan repayments. This is their first loan with ALIDE. They all live in the Irédé district of Cotonou, Benin's economic center.

Laure is the leader of the group (with her hand raised in the photo). She is in her 30's, and is married with two children who are both at school. For the past 8 years Laure has sold jewelry. She will use this loan to buy additional stock from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to increase her product range.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry items for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita es comerciante de frutas y tiene un puesto de venta en la zona de la Ceja de el Alto; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de fruta de esta temporada como ser: Paltas, Maracuya, Pomelo, etc., para ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera ayuda con los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí (El Alto), es casada y tiene cinco  hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO y la primera vez que aplica para un préstamo a través de los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en: Margarita is a fruit retailer, and she owns a stall in La Ceja, a neighborhood the town of El Alto. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seasonal fruit such as avocados, passion fruits, grapefruits and so on, in order to sell it to her customers. Through this activity she helps paying for her household expenses. She owns the house she lives in, located in Huayna Potosí, a neighborhood of the town of El Alto; she is married and she has five children. This is the second time she is asking IMPRO for a loan, and the first time she is doing so through Kiva’s lenders.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit (avocados, passion fruits, grapefruits and so on) to sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 54-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married to a retired brewery factory labourer. She has 2 dependents:  her granddaughter and one of her relatives.  In 2007, Kadiatu established her business selling local foodstuffs.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more local food for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Haizel Babe

texts.en:
Haizel Babe S., 33, is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Haizel Babe has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Haizel Babe has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat.

In the future, Haizel Babe would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, soltero vive con  sus padres en su  casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace algún tiempo, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa , los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos personales y de alguna manera ayuda económicamente a sus padres.   

José solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2400 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, ya que por falta de lluvias los pastos están escasos, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un buen precio.  José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora que con empeño a sabido salir adelante en la vida para mejorar y darle algunos gustos a sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a house that they own. The only service they receive is electricity. Their home is located in the rural section of the Department of Lambayeque. The businesses that operate in this area are related to agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

José has been raising and selling sheep for some time. He raises the animals in an area behind his house. The animals are fed balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals reach the ideal size and weight, José offers them for sale to different markets in the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo. This enables him to generate healthy profits so that he can cover his personal expenses and provide some financial assistance to his parents.

José is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2400 PEN so that he can buy more animals and the appropriate feed. Due to the lack of rain, grass is scarce. The loan will enable him to feed his animals so that he can sell them at a good price.

José is a person who is well-known in the area where he lives because he is responsible and hardworking. He has managed to get ahead in life so that he can improve himself and pay for some his parents’ expenses.

loans.use: to purchase animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad  is from the village of UPPER LAMAC, OROQ. CITY.  She is 68 years old.  Caridad is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Caridad owns and operates a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing women's tailoring services to local community members.  Caridad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caridad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Caridad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sewing materials and to repair an existing sewing machine.  This loan will be the twelveth loan taken out by Caridad from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and repair the existing sewing machine.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 31 год. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. В этой области он работает уже два года. Целью получения кредита является приобретения холодильника для торговли мороженного.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in Rudaki.  He is 31 years old and married.  His wife is a housewife and his children go to middle school.  He works in trade. He has a shop where he sells groceries.  He has been doing this work for two years.  He would like to take out a loan to buy a freezer to sell ice cream.

loans.use: buying a freezer to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: Este cliente se dedica a la agricultura y labora como vigilante desde hace más de cinco años para un dueño de fincas a orillas del mar actualmente el estado civil es acompañado. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha destinado a la  compra de insumo agrícola para la siembra de maíz, trigo etc. Para mejorar su cultivo, estos créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado para mejorar el nivel de vida de la unidad familiar.
texts.en: This client farms and has worked as a security guard for a plantation owner by the sea for more than five years.  His current marital status is 'living with somebody'.  He has had nine loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy agricultural supplies for growing corn, wheat, etc. in order to improve his crops.  His loans from CEPRODEL have been useful as they have enabled him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for sowing two 'manzanas' (3.36 acres) of corn

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
For the past ten years, Giang and her husband have made money by buying and selling charcoal, cutting and selling morning glory at a local market, and by raising pigs. To earn more money to support her family, Giang intends to take a loan to buy more pigs and charcoal so that she can increase the turnover of her businesses. She hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is married and runs a fish-selling and fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in business for 10 years.

Delfina is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Allelis Estelia

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad, Allelis Estelia es una mujer emprendedora que además de la elaboración de diferentes comestibles, los cuales vende entre sus amigos, familiares, conocidos y en algunas cafeterías del municipio de Santa Rosa al norte de Antioquia cuenta con un criadero de pollos que también comercializa en la zona. 

Esta emprendedora sueña con llegar a tener una microempresa de embutidos que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Allelis Estelia necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos y utensilios para la elaboración de sus comestibles, así mejorará su producción, será más eficiente en la elaboración de los mismos, incremenetando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Allelis Estelia is an enterprising woman who also make different types of food which she sells to her friends, relatives and other people she knows at several cafeterias in the town of Santa Rosa, to the north of Atioquia.  She has a chicken yard, and she also sells chickens in the area.

This entrepreneur dreams of having a micro-business selling sausages, which would allow her to improve her quality of life.

Currently, Allelis Estelia needs a loan to buy several ingredients and utensils for making her food, thereby increasing her production.  She will be more efficient in making the food, increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, drinks and other things to stock his store with.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Jhasmin Rosalina

texts.es:
Jhasmin tiene 20 años vive en Otavalo con su Mamá, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Se describe como una mujer alegre y divertida con deseos de superarse.

Trabaja con su mamá en la confección de ropa. Es el segundo crédito que le solicita a Fodemi y va a invertir en la compra de una máquina industrial para la confección de la ropa, lo cual le dará calidad a su producto y de esta manera incrementará sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa y seguir manteniendo a su mamá.
texts.en:
Jhasmin is 20 years old and lives in Otalvo with her mother. She is single and has no children. Jhasmin describes herself as a fun and outgoing woman who wants to succeed.

She and her mother work together in making clothes. This is the second loan she has requested from FODEMI. She will invest the money in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine for making clothes. This will allow her to produce a quality product so that she can increase her sales.

Her dream is to build a house where she can continue supporting her mother.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Giovana De Las M.

texts.es: Giovana con su nuevo creikiva comprará 3 lavadoras y materias primas e insumos para la preparación de comidas rápidas, pues quiere fortaecer estos 2 negocios aun mas. Con su anteior creikiva compro mercancia que vendió a crédito y ha recuperado practicamente toda la inversión. Ella está satisfecha con todas estas actividades y ahora se prepara para el fin de año época de gran despliegue comercial. Agradece a Kiva por apoyarla en sus proyectos de crecimiento.
texts.en: Giovana will use her new Kiva loan to buy three washing machines and raw materials and ingredients for fast-food preparation because she wants to strengthen both of these businesses still more.   She used her previous Kiva loan to buy merchandise that she sold on credit and she’s recuperated almost the entire investment.  She is satisfied with all these activities and is now getting ready for the end of the year when commercial activity spikes.  She thanks Kiva for supporting her in her growth projects.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines and raw materials and ingredients for fast food preparation.

loans.name: Samnag

texts.en:
Samnang (pictured here) is a mason, and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. He has been married since 1990 and has five children- four sons and one daughter. One is a security guard, another one is a construction worker, two are in school, and the other one is still young.

Samnang has requested a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting once already. He wants to buy one more motorbike for his son who is a security guard to drive work, so he has decided to ask for another loan of $700.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.name: Adela Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Adela Francisca es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 33 años quien tiene dos tortillerías. Ella con el crédito anterior amplio su negocio y con las ganancias se compró una cocina nueva.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 3, 9 y 12 años de edad respectivamente y este crédito lo piensa invertir en maíz y queso. Su meta es lograr tener un carro ya que le ayudaría al negocio.
texts.en: Adela Francisca is a hardworking, enterprising, 33-year-old woman who has two tortilla shops.  She used her previous loan to expand her business and used profits to buy a new stove.  She has three children who are 3, 9 and 12 years of age respectively.  She intends to use this loan to buy corn and cheese.  Her goal is to have a car because it will help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and cheese.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 51 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Cerila has a food shop selling snacks such as piniato, peanut roll, and yema or milk candy. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Cerila is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for these snacks.  Cerila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cerila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working woman and has been farming for over 10 years. 

She has been a good client with KADET LTD. in previous loans. She is asking for a new loan to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers for farming. 

She will invest any profit in more farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy wheat seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hojas de laurel y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos, la socia lo vende las hojas de laurel y los animales en el distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de hojas de laurel y ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar hojas de laurel y comprar animales como chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Ana, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Ana is 52 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She alternated her daily chores with her retail activity, selling bay leaves, and her farming activity, breeding animal such as pigs, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chickens. She sells the bay leaves and the animals in the Calca district, and thanks to this activity she provides for her children. She wants to expand her activity as a seller of bay leaves as well as her animal breeding activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy bay leaves and animals such as pigs, chickens and cuyes.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy bay leaves and animals such as pigs, chickens and cuyes to then sell them.

loans.name: Lulare Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lulare Group in Western Kenya! Florence is the facilitator of the Lulare group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Florence will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Lulare group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye est une dame qui s’est lancé dans le petit commerce depuis dix ans .Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à acheter des légumes dans les champs et à les revendre dans le marché local. C ‘est d’ailleurs pour cette raison qu’elle fait le crédit pour renforcer son activité.
Ndèye participe  à la dépense quotidienne et avec les bénéfices acquis elle souhaite aider son fils ainé qui fait du maraichage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndèye is a lady who started working in small trade ten years ago. She is married with children. Her activity is to buy vegetables in the fields for resale at the local market. This is why she sells on credit, as it helps to strengthen her business.

Ndèye helps with the daily household expenses, and she plans to use her profits to support her eldest son’s market gardening activity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
This is Rosalyn, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jimmy, a carpenter, and is a mother to her seven children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalyn is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. She sells her fish around their community.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Mary. She is single and has 2 children, aged 21 and 20, one of whom is in college. Mary has 2 additional dependents who live with her in order to attend school. In 1992, Mary established her essential drugs (pharmacy) business. When Mary left high school, she did not have someone to sponsor her because her parents were poor. She went into sales and when she had enough capital, she opened a small stall. In order to fulfill her dream of becoming a nurse, she enrolled in training as a pharmacist and she now owns a pharmacy, selling drugs to patients. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, Mary earns about SLL 2,256,000 monthly from her business.

Mary has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would now like a new loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy Pinoplex blood syrup (4 cartons @ SLL 140,000 each), pain relief (5 cartons @ SLL 50,000 each), Lucmal (anti malarial) drug (10 cartons @ SLL 120,000 each), Zincofer blood syrup (5 cartons @ SLL 140,000 each), Lucozade (10 cartons @ SLL 100,000 each) and Amodiquin hydrochlode tabs (1 carton @ SLL 250,000), with the balance used as transport fare. Mary hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 564,000.

Mary doesn't face much competition since she is the only one owning a pharmacy in the area. She serves about 60 people per day, and her business is popular because she treats her customers with care and respect. Mary is assisted by her closest family members. She usually orders twice a month through delivery van from Freetown. In the future, Mary plans to save enough money for her retirement. She feels good and nervous about the future prospects of her business because she needs someone with good experience and capabilities to run her business when she retires. She wants her child and her dependents to finish school. The loan will help as she will be able to save money. Mary is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of assorted medications

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has four children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services and a personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Earning from sale of milk." He said that his biggest challenge is poor infrastructure in the area in terms of the road network that thus increases transport costs. Animals on the farm have not been named.

Daniel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Was introduced to Juhudi Kilimo by group members." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Learnt how microfinance Institutions work to finance farmers to improve their livelihoods."

His highest monthly expense is transportation costs. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Daniel replied 'he will purchase a dairy cow to increase production.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daniel owns the following: cows, poultry and motorcycle, but does not own pigs, a pump, bicycles or automobiles. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nupi Chaokhat Lup Group

texts.en: Bijaya is 39 year old entrepreneur from Bishnupur district, Manipur. She is also the group leader of Bijaya group which comprises of 5 more enterprising women. Bijaya is married and mother of 2 kids. However the family struggles to make ends meet with their limited income. With a strong desire to educate her kids, Bijaya wants to expand her business. Thereby allowing her to take home more earnings. She sells dry and fresh fish in the local town market. Due to lack of running capital, she has never been able to keep up with demand. Other members of the group also face similar struggles. So they have applied for loan of Rs. 90000 (Rs. 15000 each). The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of the different varieties of fish. Bijaya is confident the group will benefit from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of different varieties of fish for her fish selling business

loans.name: Blanca Norma

texts.en:
My name is Blanca Norma and I sell valeadas. My business is strategically located in my neighborhood. I hace been doing this type of work for several years. I am able to support my family with my business. I am a single mother and thankfully, this business allows me to support my family and educate my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of butter, flour, firewood, condiments, beans, and other supplies

Mi Nombre es Blanca Norma, cuento con un negocio de venta de valeadas, ubicado en un lagar estrategico de mi colonia, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, ya que soy madre soltera y gracias este negocio puedo soster economicamente a mis hijos y darles educacion.

loans.use: Compra de Manteca, Harina, leña, condimentos, frijoles, lacteos y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase addiotional inventory for her pharmacy

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Mrs. Dung is 33 years old and her husband is 35 years old. They have 3 children. The oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Her husband is a day-laborer, but his work is unstable. Mrs. Dung has a small business selling foods from her home. They live in difficulty. This family needs US $70 to expand their business and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To sell foods

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en:
Micaela is 28 years old, married, with four children. Her husband works as a farmer. She embroiders traditional skirts that are used by the women in her community. Her best customers are indigenous women from her neighborhood. She belongs to the group "Liquidambar 13". With the a loan, she wants to buy more fabric to increase the production of skirts in order to start selling them to tourists that visit the city close to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MICAELA TIENE 28 AÑOS, CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR FALDAS TIPICAS USADAS POR LAS MUJERES DE LAS COMUNIDADES, ES POR ESO QUE SUS MEJORES CLIENTES SON LAS INDIGENAS DE SU CENTRO.PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE FALDAS PARA BAJAR A VENDER A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Mrs. Ourng S., a 29-year-old widow with one school-aged child, lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a small beauty salon selling different kinds of beauty products to the people in her community. With this business activity, Ourng S. can typically generate up to $10 each day in revenue. In order to generate an additional profit, Mrs. Ourng S. hopes to use the loan to decorate her shop . Another part of the money is to be shared with her relatives to open another shop selling cooked meat and a variety of drinks on the roadside of their community, where a number of travelers pass by. She hopes to have sufficient money to provide her child with aa good education and a better quality of life one day.

loans.use: To decorate her beauty salon

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man K., age 61, is a housewife. Her husband sells traditional medicine, earning about $10 per day in revenue. They have two children who help their father to sell medicine. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to use for her family’s transportation. Her husband is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family's transportation.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
”My house was constructed many years ago, so with the passing of time it has deteriorated considerably. It is urgent that I repair a fence that is about to fall, and I also want to add a room in the second floor of my home so that my family has more living space. I am requesting a $1,200 loan to repair a fence and for the construction of an additional room in the second floor of my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa hace muchos años que se construyo, así es que con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado mucho me urge reparar una barda que esta por caerse y quiero también construir un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda para tener más espacio para mi familia” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la reparación de una barda y la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda

loans.use: Repair a fence and build an additional room in the second floor of my home.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Señor Luis is 30-years-old. He is single and lives with his parents in their own home. He is the source of economic support for their family. He makes a living buying and selling all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

Luis is one of the suppliers of the stores in his city. Among the garments that he sells are: t-shirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and socks.

He is requesting a credit to be able to buy a large batch of merchandise that is being offered to him at a good price. If he succeeds in acquiring this merchandise, he will be able to offer better prices to his clients since their sales are rather high right now.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Luis tiene 30 años, el es soltero y vive con sus padres en una casa propia siendo él, el sustento de su familia. Luis se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de ropas ya sea para damas, caballeros y niños.

Luis es uno de los proveedores de las tiendas de la cuidad. Entre las prendas que vende podemos citar: remeras, pantalones, camisas, shorts, medias, entre otros.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un lote grande de mercaderías que le ofrecieron a un muy buen precio, si el logra adquirir esta mercadería, podrá ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes ya que en esta época las ventas son bastante altas.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Ruhangiz

texts.en:
Ruhangiz lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad in Azerbaijan. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Ruhangiz established her cattle breeding business in 1992. Since then, she has been successfully managing it with help from her husband and children (her daughter is pictured here). They breed cows and then sell them in the local cattle market.

Ruhangiz wants to buy more cows because she plans to expand her business. Ruhangiz applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $600 USD.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is a seamstress and sews various types of polo shirts and dresses that her neighbors and friends request from her. She has a large quantity of beautiful fabrics in her sewing workshop that she recently opened. She worked in a sewing shop before but she wanted to become more independent and thought it better to open her own business in order to feel truly content. She is single and her desire for advancement is based on her hope to offer her future family economic stability. In order to reach that goal she is already working arduously towards realizing her dream. Without a doubt, it all has a price. Stability is not created overnight. Teresa is well aware of this, and is now in need of capital in order to buy a greater quantity of fabrics in the capital where it would easier to get them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA Teresa es costurera y confecciona diversos tipos de polos y vestidos que le solicitan sus vecinos y amigos y tiene una gran cantidad de hermosas telas dentro de su taller de costura que abrió recientemente. Trabajaba en una taller de costura pero quiso independizarse y que mejor que abrir su propio negocio en la cual se siente verdaderamente contenta, es soltera y sus ganas de superación están basadas en ofrecer a su futura familia estabilidad económica y para alcanzar este propósito ya está trabajando arduamente con la esperanza de realizar sus anhelos.Sin duda todo tiene un precio y el forjarse estabilidad económica no se realiza de la noche a la mañana y esto lo sabe muy bien Teresa, a quien le urge un capital para comprar diversas telas de la capital en la que los podría obtener muy cómodo.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of fabrics.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju L. is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and her father-in-law works in a small hotel. Mrs L. is a shopkeeper.

Mrs L. opened her grocery shop two years ago to increase the quality of life of her family. She sells a variety of grocery items. She wants to further expand her business so she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy necessary grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Kob

texts.en: Mr. Kob Y. is 29 and a subsistence farmer and a pig breeder in Angk Village in Kandal Province. He is married with a child who is too young to work or study. His wife Sokna Neang is a silk weaver in the local village. Mr. Kob Y. usually hires a person to work on the rice field and just waits for the revenue. Previously, he had obtained a loan from Brasac Co.,LTD to hire a person to cultivate the rice field. Last year Mr. Kob Y. had a big problem because many insects damage his rice and thus did not make enough money to pay his worker, therefore he asked for a loan to pay the wages.

loans.use: Kob would like to pay for his employee for his rice field.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru:
Nasim K. lives in the Rudaki region with his family. He is not married and currently lives with his parents. He and his mother have a retail business and sell women's clothing on the Kovron market. He has five years of experience in this field. Nasim wants to help his mother and also separate their vendor space. By receiving a loan he will be able to have an independent business. This will also help his family increase their income. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимов Насим житель района Рудаки. Проживает со своей семьей . Он еще не женат и поэтому живет с родителями. Вместе с матерью занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке «Корвон» женской одеждой. Опыт работы в данной сфере 5 лет. Хочет помочь матери и кроме того отделить торговую точку. Получив кредит он сможет занятся бизнесом самостоятельно. Это поможет его семье увеличить доход семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. Gustavo Z. is single, lives with his mother, and is a taxi driver. Gustavo is the owner of two taxi stands. He drives one of his vehicles (which he also owns) and the other is driven by a contracted driver. He tells us with pride that it was with great effort he was able to buy the two taxi stands and his two vehicles.

The loan requested will be used for the repair of his home. In the future he would like to open a mechanic shop and be a source of jobs for more people.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Gustavo Z. es soltero vive con su madre, el se y es taxista. Gustavo es propietario de dos paradas de taxis. El conduce uno de sus vehículos y otro vehículo que también es de su propiedad lo conduce un chofer contratado. Cuenta orgulloso que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar las dos paradas y sus dos vehículos.

El crédito que se le otorgo fue utilizado en el arreglo de su vivienda ya que en el futuro desea poder abrir un taller mecánico y dar fuente de trabajo a más personas.

loans.use: Expansion of home

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Señor Yoni P. is married to Señora Sandra Elizabeth Roa with whom he has one daughter. Yoni used to work selling wood in the center of the country. With the little he earned he studied the art of fine and antique furniture making. This is how one day he finished his studies in carpentry and decided to go to the central hub of his country. With the little savings that he had, he rented a house for his family and bought a few machines to begin his work.

He wants to invest the loan he is requesting to buy wood for his work. Today, Yoni has a fine and antique furniture factory where he employs 20 people. His next objective is to open a sales location in Asunción.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky and John Glassmire, Kiva Volunteers.

El señor Yoni P. está casado con la señora Sandra Elizabeth Roa con quien tiene una hija. Yoni se dedicaba anteriormente a la comercialización de madera en el interior del país, con lo poco que ganaba fue estudiando lo que respecta a la fabricación de muebles finos y rústicos respecta. Fue así que un día luego de haber terminado sus estudios en la parte de carpintería decidió venir a la zona central de nuestro país. Con los pocos ahorros que tenia alquiló una casa para su familia y pudo comprar algunas maquinarias para empezar a trabajar.

El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de maderas para realizar sus trabajos. Hoy en día Yoni tiene una fábrica de muebles finos y rústicos donde da empleo a 20 personas. Su próximo objetivo es abrir un local de ventas en Asunción.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret F. is a 38 year old wife and mother of three kids, who are in school. She has been a food vendor for five years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups. It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy everyday, either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With this loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice, and assorted meat. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, and assorted meat.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is married with one child, who is just two months old. She is a clothes seller. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Najat is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Vin P., 51, is married and lives with five of her eight children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has worked as a worker, breaking rock. Normally, she makes around US$5 per day, while her husband works growing yams to earn less than one dollar each day. Vin P. and her husband together have contacted Credit to take out a loan of US$500 to rent a yam farm and then harvest the crop. This couple will slice the yams and then dry them in the sunshine. This investment will help increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To rent a yam farm to harvest a crop.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida A. S. sells fabric and clothing at Kissi near Elmina, Ghana. Vida has received no formal education.  She is married and has 8 children. Vida has been selling fabric and clothing since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband with meeting the family's financial needs. She is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan M. is a 26 year-old married man who lives with his newborn daughter and owns a small farm consisting of sheep. He lives and works in the small southern city called Bilasuvar (Tajikistan). Rovshan has been selling sheep for three years. Since sheep selling is a profitable business, Rovshan has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs up until now. However, his child is growing and he is expecting another child, so covering family needs has become harder. Rovshan is applying for a loan of 1200 USD to expand his activities and to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 33 años y vive con su hijo de 3 años en casa de sus padres. Ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos desde hace 3 años, su mercadería es de las líneas más confiables y mejor cotizadas de su medio. La forma de vender de Luz es ofreciendo de casa de casa a sus amistades y vecinos, y debido al incremento de sus ventas ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo con prendas de vestir para llevarlas a los trabajadores del sector salud de su localidad, ya que para ella esto significa mayor garantía cuando da al crédito sus productos, además que siempre su  clientela es fija y como les vende en su centro de trabajo, siempre los ubica y conoce cuando es fecha de pago para ir a cobrar sus cuentas. Ahora Luz mira con grandes expectativas su futuro para seguir siendo el sostén de su hijo. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella regresó a su banco comunal después de dos ciclos (préstamos consecutivos) y fue admitida porque tiene como antecedentes positivos su puntualidad y fortaleza en el trabajo en equipo. Luz esta solicitando esta cantidad para la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos, adquirirá estos productos al contado para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer al crédito, también comprará prendas de vestir al por mayor, para empezar, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and lives with her parents and her 3-year-old son. For the past 3 years she has worked selling cosmetics from one of the most trusted and valuable brands available. Luz sells her products by going to the houses of her friends and neighbors. Due to her increased sales she has decided to expand her business by also selling clothing to health care workers in her area. [By selling to more clients] she will have more security when she sells her products on credit. Regardless, she has set clients that she sells to at their workplace, she knows where they are and what day she has to go collect her payments. Luz looks toward the future with the expectation that she will continue to support her son. This is the second loan cycle with MFP. She went back to her community bank after two consecutive loans and was accepted because of her previous positive experiences, punctual payments and ability to work as a team. Luz is asking for this money to purchase more cosmetics. She will buy these products at a discount and then offer them to her clients on credit. She will also buy clothing articles to sell--to start with she will purchase undergarments to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cosmetics she sells

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 42-year-old married man with three children, living in Anjar in the Bekaa Valley. Sarkis owns a home-based workshop where he works at affixing precious stones on jewelry. Today and in order to improve his output quality, Sarkis is requesting $1,200 to buy a new microscope.

loans.use: Buy a microscope for his jewelry-making

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo a is 50 year old woman who hails from Budbudan, Hamtic, Antique. She is married and blessed with five children. She is engaged in buying and selling of fish at Dalipe market and her customers are the people of different municipalities of Antique.

Her business started with initial capital of P2,000 she got from a local moneylender. At that time she experienced hardships because of a huge interest she has to pay. This is the reason why she has to close down her business.
 
Whe she joined the ASHI microfinance program, she was able to revive her business.  She is now requesting her fourth loan  of PHP20,000 she can use to purchase different kind of fish direct from the fishpond. The purchase of different kind of fish is a great help in growing her business. She also into  buying and selling of "nipa" (local palm leaves)  hut and “bubo” (a fishing gear used to catch prawns).
 
Her aspiration in life is that her business will become successful and someday she will be called “Mayor Kuprador” -- wholesaler.  She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: Additional working capital for buying and seeling fish

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi K. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est réparateur auto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et aussi aménager son atelier pour mieux exécuter son travail et gagner la confiance de sa clientèle. Dans la vue Komi est celui qui est au milieu.
texts.en:
Komi K. is a young man, 29 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is an auto repairman in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools and also to equip his workshop in order to carry out his work better and to earn the trust of his customers. In the photo, Komi is the one in the middle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and to fix up his shop

loans.name: Shalom 3 & 8 Group

texts.en:
The members of the Shalom Bank of Hope have been with Esperanza International for about 6 loan cycles. They have been faithful in completing their payments and their businesses have experienced a certain amount of growth in profit and sales volumes.

Natividad M. is one of the group coordinators. She is a candy maker. She makes candy and sells it on the street. With this loan, she will buy the ingredients for making her candies such as corn, sweet potatoes, coconut, milk, and sugar.

She makes several types of candy. "Maiz dulce" which means "sweet corn," and is made with the whole grains of the corn kernels, then cooked in sweetened milk with cinnamon and cloves. "Dulce de coco" ("sweet cocoa") is either cooked in the stove or baked, and "dulce de batata" ("sweet potato") is a type of sweet potato pudding. Her candies have become well known in her area, but she would like to have a storefront in her house so that she can sell her candies there and avoid the walking.

Natividad's life is definitely not easy. Between cooking the candies and getting up early and walking the streets of Hato Mayor selling, she has very little time for herself and is often very tired from long days of work. She wants her three children (ages 11,12 and 15) to have a better life quality, which is why she is committed to suporting their education, hopefully until they become working professionals.

Please help us to continue to support this hard-working group of entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase a mill and products like corn, sugar, milk, sweet potatoes and coconut to make candy.

loans.name: José Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor José E. se dedica a laborar en la ciudad de Chinandega en el servicio de triciclo trasladando a las personas de un lugar a otro y de acuerdo con la distancia así es el cobro del pasaje.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día él requiere de la inversión en su triciclo y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel porque necesita la compra de los repuestos para darle el mantenimiento respectivo al triciclo y de esta forma salir adelante en su servicio de triciclo en es sector transporte.
texts.en:
Mr. José E. works in the city of Cinandega as a bicycle rickshaw driver, transporting passengers from one place to another. He charges based on the distance traveled in the journey. José needs to invest in his rickshaw, and he'd like a loan from Ceprodel to buy replacement parts. With the necessary maintenance for his rickshaw, José will get ahead in the transportation sector.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rickshaw repair

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
Dài Ngô Thị (2033971447) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Dài owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Dài has been engaged in this business for over 26 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Dài joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dài has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund which was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Dài is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Dài plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is an animal keeper. She has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for five years. She belongs to the Halengo 1 group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more avocados for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. Juliana is 22 years old, married, and has two children of ages 4 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more avocados for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Sied Raem

texts.en: S. Raem is the son of S. Y.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 5 children. He is working on the committee autocratic election and he wants to take a loan of 50000 Afghani. He is very happy for this loan process that can solve all his problems.

loans.use: For needed materials.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 40 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Dupe sells drinks and is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She wishes to say thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Selina's Group

texts.en:
Selina N. is a hard-working and friendly lady. She has been selling fish in the Lugazi central market for 22 years. She buys her fish from the landing sites in Lugazi and Mukono and, because she has been in the business for a long time, she knows where to buy which fish and from whom. 

However, Selina says that before she sold fish, she was a farmer, and because money is hard to come by for a farmer, unless one is on a large scale, she resorted to fish selling, and has no regrets about the change. She hopes to expand her business so that she can supply fish to her fellow workers so that she can be able to sell much more. 

Selina is a widow with 6 children of her own and 4 step-children that she cares for. This requires her to work so hard. 

(Benita appeared in both subgroups of the Nakazadde group and is being considered to be a member of this one.)

loans.use: Buying more fish for resale in her business.

loans.name: Las Darianas Group

texts.es:
Provenientes del Barrio Loma Linda, el grupo Las Darianas está conformado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que poseen la convicción de crecer y alcanzar sus sueños con forme al trabajo y ahínco que pongan a sus vidas.

Doña María Josefina F. S., es la coordinadora del grupo, quien tiene 42 años de edad, de los cuales lleva ya siete años trabajando en la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas conocidas como los son Vogue y venta de prendas de plata de la línea Romanel.

Ella pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de productos que le han encargado y que no ha podido comprar por falta de efectivo suficiente.

María Agustina P. F., quien trabaja en la distribución de cosméticos de marcas reconocidas internacionalmente, Meyling Ilieltt T. B. trabaja en la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros en su zona, ella compra las piezas de contado y las coloca al crédito a un precio mayor para ganar un porcentaje viable; Y María Yamileth Z. Z. quien trabaja en la confección de ropa. Ellas son las otras tres integrantes del grupo.

loans.use: Productos que tiene encargados

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 50-year-old single man living with his brother. He owns three rental homes which provide enough income to improve the lives of his brother and himself. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $500 for repairs and maintenance on a rental home.

loans.use: Maintenance for a rental home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is married and has two children. She has received education through senior high school. Her husband is a pensioner.

Victoria sells goods such as onions and groundnuts (peanuts) at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2008. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Victoria will use the loan to buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more onions, groundnuts and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando es casado con la joven señora de nombre Mayela Yoseth Campos, ellos son padres de 3 niños todos pequeñitos, por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros ya que en la parte posterior de la vivienda es donde Armando esta realizando la construcción de su hogar y por el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su familia política. 
El labora para una empresa reconocida a nivel estado desde hace 8 años, en el departamento de oficial de producción obteniendo muy buenos ingresos. 
Ellos aunque son una familia joven son personas muy responsables y en busca de un buen futuro, están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de la losa de concreto de su vivienda en construcción.
texts.en:
Señor Armando is married to a young woman named Mayela Yoseth Campos. They are parents of 3 children who are all very small. At the moment, they live in a house with his in-laws. In the back of that house Armando is building his house with the support of his in-laws. He has worked for 8 years as a production department official for a firm that is well-known at the state level, and he makes a very good income. They are a young family, but they are very responsible people who are looking for a good future. They are transacting this loan in order to place a concrete slab roof on their home under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put a concrete slab roof on their home under construction

loans.name: Syprose Achieng

texts.en:
Syprose O., 35, is a married shopkeeper with three children.

In her shop, which she has run for seven years, she sells household food and products such as sugar, rice flour, cooking fats, baking flour, soda mild and detergents.

She runs the operation by herself and the store is located by the side of a main road. It is a busy location, but she does face significant competition. In the future, she hopes to establish another branch of her business and become the most established shop in the area.

Syprose describes herself as hardworking and patient.

loans.use: Additional stock for store, e.g., rice, sugar, milk

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie L. is from the town of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily toiletries such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her store. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mardy's Group

texts.en:
Mardy C. is from the village of Luna. She is 44 years old. Mardy is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mardy is single. To make a living, Mardy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products from Personal Collection, MSE, Sundance, BoardWalk and AVON in the local community. Mardy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mardy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mardy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Mardy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is a 44-year-old single mother who lives alone in a province of Mongolia. All her children live on their own. She lives in a Mongolian traditional tent called a ger.

Narangerel has been able to support herself because of the success of her consumer goods and grocery trading business. She started her business in 2004 with working capital of 800,000 tugrug (~$560 US) which has increased to 2,000,000 tugrug (~$14,000 US) since. The increased profits are due to her good business skills and good customer service. She has cultivated very good relationships with both her customers and suppliers and believes that these relationships are the key to her success.

Narangerel would like to expand her product offerings and is therefore requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan in order to buy a greater variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products

loans.name: Barrio Pil Group

texts.es: El grupo “Barrio Pil“ esta representada por la señora Jajhaira Concepción y conformada por 14 miembros es un grupo responsable y dinámico que va cursando ya un tercer ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad. Todos los socios poseen sus propias fuentes D. ingreso como la venta D. libros, leche, ropa, pan y al servicio domestico, costura y mecánico. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias venden en la periferia D. la ciudad más que todo en su barrio y algunas veden en las ferias vecinales por lo que no tienen mucha competencia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mayor mercadería, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo como maquinas surf hiladoras, tornos y la apertura D. nuevos negocios.  En cuanto a las expectativas a futuro todos los integrantes desean mejorar sus viviendas y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y algún día verlos profesionales algo que una mayoría D. ellos no pudo hacer por falta D. recursos y no quieren que les pase igual a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Barrio Pil" group is represented by Jajhaira Concepción and is maD. up of 14 members. It is a very responsible and dynamic group that is in its third loan cycle and is always punctual and responsible. All of the members have their own sources of income; for example, selling books, milk, clothes and bread, providing domestic services and working as seamstresses and mechanics. In terms of the competitive environment, the members sell in the outskirts of the city, mostly in their neighborhood. Some sell in the neighboring markets, so they do not have much competition.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise, equipment and working tools like machines for spinning thread and potter's wheels. Some of the loan will be put toward opening new stores. All of the members hope to improve their houses and proviD. their children with a better education. They hope to one day see their children working as professionals, something that the majority of them could not do for lack of resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Edelien

texts.en:
Edelien Y. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult-aged children. Edelien owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as powder, oil, bread, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.
