Otoniel es un hombre que se muestra muy trabajador y con mucha disciplina de trabajo que tiene sus metas bien claras y sabe para donde va su negocio que en la actualidad tiene un capital de trabajo de $3.440.000 COP, un margen de utilidad de 42,8% y proyecta con su nuevo credikiva una utilidad de 50%, teniendo en cuenta la época en la cual esta haciendo la inversión a su negocio, que es de gran movimiento comercial y las solicitudes de sus clientes rentables a las cuales responderá.
texts.en: Otoniel C. S. is 36 years old and owns a business called "Variedades Daniel", where he has sold precious stones, shoes, clothing, and stationery, and other items for 11 years. This experience has allowed a slight growth of his business, but many times he does not have enough working capital to adequately stock his store, and he has to wait to pick up the money from his credit sales in order to stock the store and fulfill his clients. This is the reason for his first credit with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, because it will give him working capital to invest during a great season of the year, when sales usually increase. He will purchase cleaning supplies, baby clothing, and household goods, which he will pack with Christmas decorations, to attract the attention of his clients, during the season in which friends, neighbors, and relatives exchange gifts. His dream is to have a great, well-stocked store and his own house. However, his greatest challenge is the seasons in which sales decrease, and he has to figure out how to attract clients with low prices and a nice display. Otoniel is a very hard-working man with a lot of discipline in his job. His goals are clear, and he knows where his business is going. Currenlty, he has a working capital of $3.440.000 COP and a profit margin of 42.8%. He projects it will reach 50% with his new credit, keeping in mind the season in which he is making the investment in his business, which is highly commercial and profitable, and he will be able to respond to his clients' requests.

loans.use: He will buy cleaning tools, baby clothing, and household goods which he will pack with Christmas decorations to attract the attention of his clients.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 22 años es una joven madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Agustín de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Jairo de 3 y Estrella de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que Alejandrina se dedica es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, también comprará insecticidas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 22 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working young mother who lives in her own home with her husband, 26 year-old Agustín, and her 2 beloved children, 3 year-old Jairo and 1 year-old Estrella.  She would like to provide them with a better quality of life.

Alejandrina's business is growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Every day she gets up very early in the morning and starts looking after her farm since she knows that the more care she takes of her crops, the more produce she will obtain at harvest time.  What Alejandrina most likes about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a lot of patience.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  Over time, she would like to buy more land so that she can grow more crops.

This is Alejandrina's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she must be punctual in making her loan repayments if she wants to have access to another loan in the future.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.  She will also buy insecticides.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Anielka Nahima

texts.es:
Anielka es  madre de un hijo, casada, muy emprendedora, organizada. Para un bienestar familiar
Hoy en día cuenta con dos trabajos, el cual realiza en diferentes horarios. Trabaja como ejecutiva telefónica empresa privada y junto con su esposo están en un  grupo musical lo que viene a mejorar gran parte de los ingresos para los gastos básicos y personales.

Este es su segundo crédito en donde ampliara más el cuarto ya que tiene poco espacio y que es de gran relevancia. Pues Afodenic ha sido el que ha dado el apoyo financiero para lograr estas mejoras en su vivienda. En donde comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Anielka has a son, is married and is very entrepreneurial and organized. For the well-being of her family, she currently has two jobs that she works on different schedules.  She works as secretary at a private company and she is in a musical group with her husband.  This helps her to increase her income so that she can pay for her basic and personal expenses.

This is her second loan with Afodenic, which she will use to increase the size of a room in her home.  The room has very little space and is of great importance.  Afodenic has given her financial support to buy construction materials to make these improvements on her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate a room in her home

loans.name: Romel

texts.es:
Romel, reside en Semsembra departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos, Romel tiene 39 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de ganado y el procesamiento de productos lácteos,  como cuajada, queso, crema, este negocio lo tienen desde hace mucho tiempo, pues sus familias desde siempre se  han dedicado a criar ganado y a comercializar los productos provenientes de la leche,  por el momento él cuenta con el apoyo de algunos cuñados y amigos, la ventaja de este negocio es que la producción es todo el año y que ellos tienen experiencia en el ganado.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de harinilla y heno (zacate), ya que en esta época de verano se debe comprar estos alimentos para el ganado puesto que los terrenos secan su pasto por la época, este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para cubrir con la alimentación de un buen tiempo para el ganado, en esta actividad los riesgos son mínimos y por la experiencia que se tiene buscan la manera de forma anticipada de mantener en buenas condiciones al ganado para que siempre produzca leche.
Su sueño es poder darle a sus hijos y esposa una vida mejor, es por tal motivo que trabaja para que su familia tenga una condición estable, proveyendo lo necesario para ellos, así también quiere desarrollarse y crecer en el área agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Romel lives in Semsembra in the department of Morazán with his wife and two children. Romel is 39 years old. He raises livestock and makes dairy products such as curd, cheese and cream. He has been in this business for a long time since his family has always raised livestock and sold dairy products. Currently, he counts on the support of some of his brothers-in-law and friends. The benefit of this business is that production is year-round and that he has experience with livestock. 

Romel is requesting a loan to buy middlings and hay (grass) because he has to buy this feed for the livestock during the summer season because the grasses are dried depending on the season. This loan will help a lot in covering the livestock feed for a long time. The risks are minimal in this business and because of the experience he has he finds a way in advance to maintain the livestock in good condition so that they can always produce milk. 

His dream is to be able to provide his children and wife with a better life. This is why he works so that his family can have stable conditions by providing the necessary for them. He also wants to develop and grow in the agricultural field.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Artesanos Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Artesanos inicia su decimo ciclo con 14 socias. Flora es la Presidenta del Bancomunal Artesanos, es casada, tiene 62 años y 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. ganados en la feria D. Toro Wichccana y éste oficio lo aprendió desD. niña D. sus padres. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. ganados. Su sueño es poder ahorrar para tener más capital, para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Artesanos" communal bank is in its tenth year with 14 members.  Flora is the president of the bank.  She is 62 years old and married with five children.  She sells livestock at the Toro Wichccana market.  She learned this livelihood as a child from her parents.

She plans to use the loan to buy more livestock.  Her dream is to save enough to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa M. is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past five years, Abenawa has been selling food products, including corn, in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. The income she earns from her business helps pay for the children’s school fees and household utility bills. 

Abenawa will use her loan to expand her business by increasing the sale of corn and expanding the variety of food products she sells. Abenawa would like to reinvest her profits into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and expand business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
In life, all things are possible. Liza Q., 39, banks on this optimistic truth and applies it to her life. She reached only high school, but being a community partner of CCT* gives her the hope of running a profitable business.  She is one of CCT's Community Servant Leaders as a volunteer. Liza is married to Roberto, who operates a tricycle (taxi). Their family of four children lives in Binondo, Manila.

Liza does direct selling. She orders products from the local beauty brands, Personal Collection and M. S. E., based on the preferences of her customers. Also, she sells vaioius other items, from diapers to eggs. Her 16-year old daughter helps her with the business.  Liza has been doing this for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of Php10,000.

To help her grow her business, she has applied for a Php30, 000 loan. She needs this to purchase additional stock.

The difficulty of collecting payments for the ordered products is Liza’s primary business concern. She also worries about the maintenance of the tricycle. Liza prays for a breakthrough in the growth of her businesses. She believes that, like many things, this is possible.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase stock ordered in advance by customers

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina tiene 47 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, comenzó a trabajar  desde muy joven inicio este medio de vida, pues tenía que mantener a sus 5 hijos actualmente solo 3 están a su cargo. Ella siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su negocio pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de  pinturas de uñas, talcos, cremas, sabanas y calzado. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: María Delfina is 47 years old and her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She started working when she was very young as she had to support her five children.  Currently only three of her children are still in her care.  María has always been a very hard-working person and she enjoys her work.  Her customers request different products from her.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy nail polish, talcum powder, creams, sheets and shoes.  Her wish is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 43 years old. He lives in the village of Ruisi, Kartli Region, with his family – his wife and two sons, who are 10 and 5 years old. The elder son goes to the secondary school. 

The main source of income for Jemal’s family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have six milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it to the retailers in the same village. Also the family owns an agricultural plot with the area of 3 ha, where cabbages and apple trees are grown. Most of the harvested fruits and vegetables are sold locally. The family is also involved in beekeeping; they have five beehives. Honey gathered from these beehives is sold locally. 

With the requested loan Jemal plans to purchase a tractor. He will use it to till his own plot, which will reduce his cost for tilling. On the other hand he will work with the tractor on neighbors’ plots and get additional income.  

Jemal plans to reinvest the profits in agriculture – purchasing additional plots of land and more beehives.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Marina Floricelda

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Marina es socia fundadora del banco Comunal y le gusta porque las socias son muy cumplidas, ella se desempeña como tesorera, función que cumple muy bien ya que es por el bien del grupo. Tiene 40 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo tres años. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera.

Tiene una mini tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, carne, pescado camarón, queso, aguas, colas y helados,  también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, colas, helados y otros productos.
  
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y  estudiar  una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
In the small town of Rocafuerte, the members of La Union Hace La Fuerza (Union Gives Us Strength) village bank meet every 15 days.  This region is known for its delicious desserts prepared by the locals; these desserts are well-known throughout the country.

Marina is the founding member of the village bank and she enjoys it because the other members are very accomplished.  She serves as the treasurer, a work she performs because she knows it is for the good of the group.  She is 40 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her partner with whom she has a 3 year old boy.  Her partner works in a shrimp factory.

She runs a small general store out of her home where she sells rice, sugar, beef, fish, shrimp, cheese, water, soft drinks, and ice cream.  She also sells certain medicines and other items.  She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm.  She buys the products in the city of Portoviejo and others are delivered to her at her store.

This loan is to stock her store; she will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, soft drinks, ice cream and other products.

Her dream is to have a bigger business and to study to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy rice, tuna, detergent, soft drinks, water, and ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita C. is from the village of Tagodalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Juanita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2011, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is an active and funny woman. She is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as an entrepreneur. 
Gulsara is engaged in retailing household goods. She likes her business and she is pleased to do it. She would like to make more profit so she can open a commercial store. Gulsara also would like to expand her business and increase the assortment of goods, and for this purpose she requested a loan of 10,000 Somoni. She hopes that the lenders will support her and help her to improve her living conditions.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy another assortment of goods .

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Susana has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children
. 
Amelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amelita hopes to see her business investment will be more successful and could invest successful things to her family especially to her six children.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Ko´e Pyahu, se conformó en  julio de 2.010, en la ciudad de Bella Vista y renuevan en el 3er ciclo, con 13 integrantes. En el ciclo anterior estaban 12 integrantes en el comité, e ingresó una persona más al grupo.
La directora general del comité, Adelaida tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un pequeño emprendimiento de creación y venta de bijouteríes, que con mucha imaginación combina los diferentes elementos a fin de obtener los mejores diseños para sus clientes. Posee la creatividad necesaria para la creacion de sus diseños y se denomina asi misma como una persona creativa y trabajadora.
Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo fabricación y venta de manualidades, artesanías varias, bijoueríes, al comercio, venta de ropas, entre otros.
Todas son muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, ellas luchan para ayudar a sus familias para el sustento diario.
texts.en:
The Ko'e Pyahu women's committee first met in July 2010 in the city of Bella Vista.  They're starting their 3rd round of funding with 13 members.  There were 12 members for the last funding round and the've added one new member to the group for this one.  
The group's director, Adelaida, 40, operates a small business making and selling costume jewelry.  She combines different elements to create the best designs for her customers.  She's well known for being creative and her products reflect her flair for design.
The group's members operate a range of businesses.  For example, some make and sell handicrafts and costume jewelry and others work at various retails businesses. 
All the group's members are selfless and hard working, struggling day to day to provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a costume jewelry business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Midred is married and she is now 51 years old. She owns and manages a small general store where she sells different grocery items. Mildred has been in this business for almost 7 years. 

Mildred is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell. She usually earns about PHP 6,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Mildred hopes to make her business grow in order to earn a higher income to help her husband in gaining income for the sake of their children's futures. She is thankful with the financial assistance offered by the Kiva lenders that helps her to strengthen her small business. She believes that she can improve it with the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 73 años; la socia es soltera; La socia es docente de profesión, la socia ya es cesante, ahora ella vive de la renta de sus habitaciones, la socia también alquila sus tiendas en el centro y le renta bien, es solo que ella está dentro del banco comunal desde hace 13 años y siempre es un buen motivo para ver a las viejas amistades y ellos se reúnen una vez por mes, hacen sus actividades como comidas y se reúnen a compartir, ella en esta ocasión saca el crédito para su uso personal, la socia que es una señora muy jovial nos comenta que con ello se comprara unas camisas y chompa, pagara los recibos de sus vivienda. La socia ira pagando a su banco comunal poco a poco con el dinero de sus rentas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 73-years-old and single.  She is a teacher by profession but she’s now retired.  She lives off room rental income.  She also rents stores downtown and does well.  But she’s been in the communal bank for 13 years and it’s always a good reason to see old friends when they meet once a month.  They have activities like lunches and they get together to share.  On this occasion, she needs the loan for her personal use.  She is a very jovial woman and she comments that she’ll use the loan to buy some shirts and a sweater and to pay her home’s utility bills.  She will repay the communal bank little by little with money from her rentals.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy shirts, a sweater and to pay her utility bills.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 28 years old while the youngest is 12.

Mila is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She tills land where she plants and harvests rice. Mila is able to provide for her family's needs through her farm. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her snack foods business.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from selling jewelries.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack foods business.

loans.name: Dukundumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Lydia fait partie du groupe Dukundumurimo. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 46 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a 5 enfants de 7 à 22 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Lydia est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 200 kgs de pommes de terre, 50 kg de fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘augmenter la capacité en achetant d’autre champs. Dans les prochaines années, Lydia voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans son secteur et bâtir une autre maison pour sa famille et continuer à payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lydia is part of the group Dukundumurimo. She was born in Rwanda and is 46 years old. She is married and has five children, from 7 to 22 years old. The five children are in school. She has an 8th grade education. 

Lydia is a farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 200 kg of potatoes and 50 kg of fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor. 

Her strategy for business growth is to increase her capacity by buying more fields. In the next few years, Lydia would like to become a major farmer in her sector and to build another house for her family, as well as to continue covering her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy 200 kg of potatoes and 50kg of fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 03 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Aydee, una mujer de principios y valores, menciona que ante la separación mancomunada de su conviviente trato de sobre salir adelante y no se amilano ante ese problema, hoy con una sonrisa despejada cuenta que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para su queridos hijos para luego enrumbar a su trabajo cotidiano que esta en la chacra. Para ella no existe los días de feriado, ya que tienen que trabajar continuamente para tener una buena producción y dar el mejor porvenir a sus queridos hijos. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el cacao, café y frutos de maní, los cuales vende a buenos precios en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su plantas. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también y agradece de ante mano a los financistas ya que esta segura de contar con el apoyo de ellos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de café, para luego cultivarlas y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Aydee, age 40, ia a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her three beloved children.  What she wishes for the most is to give them a better quality of life.  In order to do so she is prepared to work very hard.  Aydee is a woman of principles and values.  She says when she faced the separation from her life partner she tried to get ahead.  She did not falter when she faced this problem.

Now with a bright smile she says that she gets up very early every day in order to prepare the food for her beloved children.  Then she heads out for her daily work at the farm.  For her there are no holidays because she has to work continually in order to have a good production and to give her beloved children a better future.

The main products that she grows are cacao, coffee, and peanuts.  She sells them for a good price in the city of San Francisco.  What she likes the most about her work is the freedom that she has working on her crops.  She is able to freely enjoy her green fields.  She has been doing this business activity for 15 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be taking care so that her crops are not are not infested with insects, which could damage her plants.  In the future she plans to buy new land.  With new land she would be able to increase her income and improve her beloved children’s quality of life.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her payments, and she plans to be punctual now as well.  She thanks the lenders ahead of time because she is sure to count on their support.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy more coffee seeds to later plant and benefit from their yield.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de leche y queso y también se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz, la socia vende leche, queso en las diferentes ferias que existe, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche, queso y maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar queso, leche y maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Sra. Ana Maria, belongs to the San Bartolome de Tambo Real communal bank, which is located in the district of Anta, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Ana Maria is 32 and is a single mother with 3 children. She sells milk and cheese and she is also a farmer. She has a plot of land where she plants corn. She sells milk and cheese at different markets and wants to expand her business selling milk and cheese and corn. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, cheese and corn wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cheese, milk and corn wholesale.

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela is 24 years old and single with one child. Stela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, shampoo, and canned goods.

Stela has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending and pig fattening. Stela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 26 years old, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She buys and sells secondhand clothes, a business she has operated ever since she dropped out of school. Josephine wants a loan to pay for her children's school fees. She wants to see her children attain degrees as minimum qualifications. Her desire is a boutique in a busy town.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is 46 years old and married with seven children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a business planting and harvesting taro. Serafina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

Serafina is requesting a 1500 WST loan to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or 250 USD per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Hope C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Hope C Group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the Hope C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Rosemary takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, she will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Hope C group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the picture the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer for the last five years. He is 35 years married to Caroline who is a house wife and blessed with three children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staffs in his area of habitat. Being this is his fourth loan he planned to spend to purchase farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dreams are to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
CONFIANCE est un regroupement de sept femmes mariées qui  ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans,   3 enfants et qui  vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KADI  la première à droite, fait le commerce de  condiments dans ce groupe de femmes CONFIANCE. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3cartons de cube maggie, 25kg de sel gemme, 100kg d’oignons, 3 paniers de houx frais, 4paniers de tomates fraiches, 2 paniers d’ aubergines au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Confiance is a group of seven women, who average 37 years of age with three children each; the majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their fourteenth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Kadi, on the far right, sells condiments in the Confiance group of women. With her loan she is planning to buy three cartons of Maggi stock cubes, 25 kg of rock salt, 10kg of onions, three baskets of fresh holly, four baskets of fresh tomatoes and two baskets of egg-plants at Sikasso's Grand Market and in surrounding villages. She resells at Sikasso's Grand Market, at a fixed place, and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Geghetsik

texts.en:
Geghetsik lives in Aygestan village with her husband, sons, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. For thirteen years already, Geghetsik has sustained her family by cattle-breeding and land cultivating.

To improve the conditions of her household, Geghetsik plans to increase her income. This loan will help her to purchase cattle and forage (feed). Geghetsik will expand her farm and insure a more prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage

loans.name: Sikuku

texts.en:
Sikuku is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her major dream is to establish a place to sell food in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat oil and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat oil and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000. 

With the loan, she wants to offer various treatments, such as hair cuts, hair coloring, nail painting, makeovers and a variety of other services. She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has employed one person to help her, since she alone cannot tend to her numerous clientele, who like to come to her because of her excellent work. 

She also sells beauty and personal hygiene products, which she offers while she works on her clients. Patricia has had her salon for years, and it has been going very well for her.

loans.use: to provide hair coloring, nail painting and makeovers.

loans.name: Maendeleo Visiga Group(Please Delete)

texts.en:
Theodesia who is in her mid 30s is a divorcee with two children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 7am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store and to sell soft drinks. She dreams of building her own house.

Theodesia will be accountable for paying back the loan.(PLEASE DELETE THIS DOCUMENT)_

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store and to sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine would like to construct a big poultry house and keep 600 layers

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.en:
Amélévi K. was born in 1965 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children and takes care of her brother. Unable to continue secondary school, she started her business selling water (Pure Water). With a husband who does not have a stable job, she has trouble meeting her family’s needs on her own. It is through her business selling water that she arduously tries to meet those needs.

In order to improve her business, meaning to sell water or Pure Water wholesale and retail and to rent a store and increase her profits, she is asking for a loan of $600. Once she has realized her dream, her quality of life will have improved.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Amélévi est née en 1965 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec un autre frère à charge. N’ayant pas la chance de continuer les études secondaires, elle a commencé son commerce par la vente de l’eau (pure water). Avec un mari qui n’a pas un emploi aussi stable, elle arrive difficilement seule à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est par son commerce de vente d’eau qu’elle s’investit péniblement dans cette tâche.

Pour améliorer son commerce c'est-à-dire la vente en gros et en détails d’eau ou pure water, louer un magasin et accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit de $600. Une fois ce rêve réalisé, ses conditions de vie seront améliorées.

loans.use: Wholesale and retail sale of mineral water (Pure Water)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 26 years old and very hardworking. Even though she has suffered very much, this hasn’t caused her to give up. She has a 3 year-old son named Sergio Armando. His love and affection keeps up his mother’s spirits. She is a single mother because the man she was going to marry abused her both physically and emotionally. She receives no financial help from the child’s father because she has lost all communication with him. Rosario only completed fourth grade and couldn’t continue studying because, when she was 14 years old, her mother her mother died slowly of a disease that was too costly for the family to treat.

Loan: Rosario says that the experience she has gained by being included in the Friendship Bridge women’s group called Pakachelaj has been very good. She has been able to put into practice some of the leadership skills she has learned as the group’s secretary and she has participated in two loan cycles with Friendship Bridge. She will invest this new loan in cultivating vegetables: onions and carrots (vegetables that grow well in her area) and some export crops, such as broccoli and snow peas. A small part of the loan will be invested in raising chickens of a local breed. The amount she is requesting is $425.00.

Rosario’s Dreams: She would like to provide as much education as possible to her son—she hopes to see him achieve a profession. She hopes that during the next few years she will be able to increase her agricultural production to be more highly competitive in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario es una mujer de 26 años, muy trabajadora y aunque ha sufrido muchísimo eso no ha sido motivo para que ella se dé por vencido, tiene un niño de tres años de edad el es Sergio Armando un niño que con su cariño anima a su madre ya que es madre soltera porque con la persona con la que se iba a casar la golpeaba mucho y verbalmente la daño muchísimo actualmente no recibe ningún apoyo para la manutención de su hijo debido a que toda la comunicación con el padre del niño se perdió. Estudio hasta el cuarto grado de primaria y no pudo seguir estudiando pues cuando ella tenía catorce años, su madre murió de una enfermedad que según manifiesta era demasiada grave y el tratamiento de ésta, era muy costosa y como no pudieron con esto la madre fue muriendo lentamente.

CREDITO: Rosario manifiesta que la experiencia que ha obtenido en Puente de Amistad al estar incluida en un grupo de mujeres de nombre Pakachelaj, ha sido muy buena ya que ha podido poner en practica un tanto de liderazgo comunitario dentro de este grupo pues ella era la secretaria del grupo y ha participado en dos ciclos de crédito con la institución. Ella invertirá el capital, en el cultivo de hortalizas: cebolla, zanahoria (cultivos de la zona) y algunos cultivos de exportación como Brócoli y arbeja dulce y una pequeña parte para la cría de algunas gallinas criollas. Y el monto que solicita actualmente es de $ 425.00.

  • LOS SUEÑOS DE ROSARIO:

    • Brindarle todo el estudio posible a su hijo ya que desea verlo hecho todo un profesional.Desea que en unos años logre aumentar su producción agrícola y ser competitiva en otro nivel productivo del área.

loans.use: To grow vegetables such as carrots and onions

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Justo began his general store with savings from a harvest and with some of his son's savings. The store is well located and there is not a lot of competition where he lives. Despite not having been in business for long, his clientele has increased with time.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan to buy more merchandise because he needs to expand his field of work and increase his client base. Furthermore, he is convinced that his with more merchandise, he will see an increase in his income and have a prosperous business.

Personal Information

Mr. Justo is 55 years old and his children work because they are all grown now. His business is for his later years and those of his wife because he can no longer do physical labor. His house is made of cement and he also has the support of his wife who also helps sell products from home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Justo empezó su negocio de venta de víveres con un ahorro de una cosecha que y con unos ahorros de su hijo. La tienda tiene buena ubicación y no hay mucha competencia por donde el vive y a pesar de que no tiene mucho tiempo de haberla comenzado su clientela ha mejorado con el tiempo

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería pues necesita ampliar su campo de trabajo e incrementar su cartera de clientes. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero.

Información Personal

Justo tiene 55 años de edad y sus hijos trabajan pues todos son mayores el negocio de Justo servirá para la vejez de el y se su esposa pues el ya no puede hacer trabajos forzados su casa es de cemento y cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda en casa vendiendo también los productos.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Leonor Antonio T. is 53 years old and a mother of 10 children. She was raised solely by her mother in a large family with 8 siblings. Since she never knew her father, her family’s financial situation did not afford her the opportunity to study. Since she was very young she worked to support her family. She has two plots of land with irrigation. With advice of some people who knew about HLUVUKI ADSEMA, she applied for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies. Her work supports the community and provides employment for one young woman and her husband. With the income from selling produce she is able to support her family and pay for the education of her children in Boane, in the cities of Matola and Maputo and to care for the health of her children and three grandchildren. With the loan for 15,000MT she plans to purchase additional seed for various crops to meet the increasing demand for her produce.

Her work has a large impact on the community. In addition to providing employment to one person and her husband, she provides fresh products to the neighborhood of Mafuiane and to the city where she brings her produce to sell. She hopes to increase the area of cultivation from 0.75HA to 1.25HA to harvest more food.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

LEONOR ANTONIO T., de 53 anos de idade, mãe de 10 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade da sua mãe, numa família alargada de 8 irmãos. A situação financeira da família, uma vez que não chegou a conhecer o seu pai, criou-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde a sua infância trabalha na machamba para a sua sobrevivência e a da família. Possui dois (2) terrenos com sistema de regadio .Por recomendação de algumas pessoas soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA e aproximou-se para solicitar um empréstimo para a compra de insumos agrícolas. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade e providência emprego a um jovem e ao seu marido. Com os rendimentos da venda de vegetais suporta os encargos familiares. as despesas de educação para seus filhos em Boane, cidades da Matola e Maputo, assim como as de saúde para seus filhos e três netos, com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar mais sementes para diversificaras culturas de rendimento para satisfazer a procura de vegetais .

A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade pois para alem de providenciar o emprego a um (1) jovem e o seu marido fornece produtos frescos ao bairro de mafuiane e da cidade para onde leva os produtos e tem como perspectiva aumentar as areas de cultivo de 0,75 para 1,25 ha de modo a produzir mais comida.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land preparation

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Mrs. Christiana A. is 45 years old, she is married with four children, and she lives in Benin City. She buys yams from the village and sells them to people living in her community. This is a business she learned for 6 months before she opened her business in 2005. She is an LAPO. She is in need of $425 to buy more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Christiana would like to buy more yams to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 35, owns a dress and handbag store at the market in Takoradi. Although she is still has a young spirit, Joyce has been in business for 10 years now and her customers are continually increasing. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more products to meet her customers' demands.

Currently she purchases her products from a middleman, who buys from Togo. If she receives the loan, she will have enough capital to travel to Togo herself and purchase her stock. This will increase her profits significantly.

Joyce is a member of the lending group, Kaesewokan. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The picture shows Joyce with her group members, who have all purchased bags from Joyce.

loans.use: To purchase dresses and handbags.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus' husband works as a laborer's aide, which was not enough to pay all the expenses of the household and their three children. In addition, his job is on contracts and sometimes it can take him months to get a new job, so Maria needed to have an extra source of income so they would not be unprotected in case her husband went without a job for a long time. With the help of a comadre (very close female friend) who suggested she sell natural products, she started her business. First she did a demonstration in her home, and that is where she started selling these products.

However, she is being requested more and more products, because through the recommendation of her customers she is acquiring new customers who are placing orders which Maria de Jesus cannot cover. This is why Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for US $375, which she will pay in a period of 4 months. WIth this money, Maria de Jesus will be able to buy more products to increase her profit and cover all the expenses of her family, who need her so much. With your help, Maria de Jesus will be able to support her family and her business

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

. El esposo de María de Jesús trabaja como ayudante de albañilería lo cual no era suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de la casa y sus tres hijos. Además de que su trabajo es por contratos y en ocasiones tarda meses en encontrar otro contrato es por eso que María necesitaba tener una fuente extra de ingresos para poder obtener dinero y así no quedarse desprotegidos en caso de que su esposo se quede mucho tiempo sin trabajar. Con la ayuda de una comadre que fue quien le recomendó que vendiera productos naturales que comenzó a venderlos. Primero hizo una demostración en su casa y fue ahí donde comenzó a vender estos productos.

Sin embargo cada vez le están pidiendo más productos y con la recomendación de sus clientes tiene nuevos clientes quienes le están haciendo pedidos que María de Jesús no a podido surtir es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María de Jesús podrá comprar más productos y así acrecentar sus ganancias para poder sacar para los gastos de su familia que tanto necesitan de ella. Con tu ayuda María de Jesús podrá sacar adelante a su familia así como a su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi H., 33 years old, is the 5th member of the 14th branch of the Fund. She is living with her husband and 2 children in Quang Xuong town, Thanh H.. Besides working on her 5 rice fields (360 m2 / each field), her main activity is to weave sedge mat to increase the income and repay weekly. Mrs. H. uses the money borrowed from the Fund to buy more materials (jute, sedge) to weave mats. Her income from weaving mats is stable. Her family life is improved: they have better and more nutritious meals, their children are sent to school. The price for one sedge mat is 4-6 USD. Her current income is 120 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 400 USD to buy more jute and sedge.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Hòa, 33 tuổi, thành viên năm thứ năm của chi nhánh 14, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Ngoài làm 5 sào ruộng, công việc chủ yếu của gia đình chị là làm chiếu để tăng thu nhập và lấy tiền trả hàng tuần. Vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Hòa sử dụng mua nguyên liệu (đay, cói) về dệt chiếu. Nguồn thu từ làm chiếu ổn định, kinh tế gia đình chị Hòa dần được nâng cao, chất các bữa ăn được bảo đảm, con cái được đi học đến nơi đến chốn. Giá một đôi chiếu từ 4-6USD, thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình đạt 120USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay mức vốn 400USD để mua thêm cói và đay.

loans.use: Buy sedge to weave mat

loans.name: Razimat

texts.en: Razimat U. lives in the Asht region of Tajikstan and is married with four children. Mr. U. has his own livestock business. He also works in a collective farm, but his own farm brings in most of the family 's income. He raises cows, rams, and sheep. With 10 years of experience, he has the appropriate skills and knowledge to succeed. Mr.U. is applying for a Kiva loan of $1,200 for 8 months to purchase pedigree bulls.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree bulls.

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr:
Mr. N. is a young merchant based at a location behind the bus station in Thiès. His products are essentially tires for personal vehicles and for big trucks. He receives his merchandise by way of this brother, who is based in Europe. He is in charge of the bringing the inventory to market. Each time his brother makes a shipment, he need funds to address the costs of customs, handling, and transport.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr N. est un jeune commerçant basé derrière la gare routière de Thiès, ses produits sont essentiellement les Pneus de véhicules particuliers et gros porteurs. Il reçoit ses marchandises par le biais de son frère basé en Europe. Il est chargé de l’écoulement des stocks. A chaque envoie de son frère, il a un besoin de fonds pour faire face aux frais de dédouanement, de manutention, et de transport.

loans.use: To cover the costs of customs, handling, and transport, and to transport his inventory of tires located in the port of Dakar

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar H. was married 35 years ago and lives in Lahore, a Pakistani city famous for its gardens. Mukhtar has eight children: five girls and three boys. Her husband runs a grocery store that he started five years ago. Before this shop he worked at a local company for a meager income.

Mukhtar and her husband are borrowing to buy inventory for their store. She is very hopeful that their business will flourish in leaps and bounds and they will be able to marry their daughters with dignity.

loans.use: Buy inventory for a grocery store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. sells underwear and childrens clothing at the local market. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder in the village, but his income is not sufficient to support the family.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory for resale to help increase profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Dum

texts.en:
Dum S., 37, lives with her husband, Rous Chamroeun, and their four children in the Prey Veng province. She sells spices and herbs in the local food market. She typically makes $5 (US dollars) per day. Her husband works as a bodyguard and makes $3 (US dollars) per day.

High inflation in Cambodia over this past year has made it difficult for entrepreneurs to expand their small businesses.

Dum S. would like to expand her business to increase her income, but she lacks the necessary capital to expand her inventory.

Dum S. is asking for a loan of $500 (US dollars) to purchase more spices and herbs to expand her current stock and increase her daily income. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that will allow her to expand the business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase inventory of spices and herbs

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: R. Gulbahor is 28 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband is a teacher and the salary was not enough for living; that’s why Gulbahor decided four years ago to start her own business. Currently she is the main breadwinner in the family. She is sells foods in her grocery store which she rents. She works very hard to give her dear children a good education and to make them happy. Today Gulbahor is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $1000 for the term of 12 months. Gulbahor is counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing her business!

loans.use: Purchasing of foods in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Señor Santiago P. is requesting his third loan to invest it in improving his home (putting a new roof on his house). He has worked as a teacher at the Nerpe El Triunfo school in Nueva Guinea for 10 years. This client has a 6-year-old son who is in first grade. His wife is in charge of taking care of the house and caring for their son. Don Santiago is a young, professional, responsible, honest, hard-working man. He lives in the region of La Flor, where there are few people. He is currently in his fifth year at the URACCAN University in Nueva Guinea. His dream is to keep studying and to have a stable career to help his family, who is very humble and doesn't have a lot of economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Santiago P. está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( cambierle el zinc a la casa), trabaja como docente del Nerpe El Triunfo en el municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, este cliente tiene un hijo de 6 años estudia su primer grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido del niño, don Santiago, es un hombre joven, profesional, responsable, honesto, trabajador, vive en comarca la Flor,en esta comarca son pocos los habitantes que viven en ella, actualmente esta estudiando quinto año en la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son familias muy humildes, de escasos recursos económicos

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 28 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive actualmente con una hermana mayor. Cuenta que proviene de una familia muy numerosa que está compuesta en su totalidad por 11 hermanos, 8 mujeres y 3 hombres.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación de alimentos balanceados para animales, actividad que desarrollaba junto con su padre. Lastimosamente el mismo falleció hace 8 meses por lo que tuvo que cerrar su pequeña fábrica. Fue en ese momento que decidió trabajar con su hermana en la confección de prendas de vestir debido a que era una actividad familiar que ya conocía y podría salir adelante nuevamente con dicho trabajo.

Hoy día realiza trabajos sobre pedido para un comerciante mayorista para quien confecciona los trabajos en forma constante.

Necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina de coser más, debido a que tiene muchos pedidos que cubrir y de paso le dará trabajo a otra persona.
texts.en:
Fernando is 28 years old, single, with no children. He lives with his older sister. He tells us he comes from a large family of 11 siblings - 8 women and 3 men. Previously he worked in making animal feed, an activity he did with his father. Sadly his father died 8 months ago so he had to close his small factory. It was at that moment he decided to work with his sister in making clothing items as it was a family trade that he knew and would be able to be successful again in that profession. Today he makes items to order for a commercial wholesaler for whom he has continuous orders. He needs a loan to invest in buying another sewing machine, as he has many orders to meet and he will be able to employ another person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Naoe

texts.en: Mrs. Naoe S. is a villager in Chineang in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yang Yaing, own a piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn for living. Additionally, they are breeders who raise two cows, three buffaloes, and three pigs. In their plantation, they now have a problem because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She will use part of the money to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Naoe S., 33, is married without any children. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marissa Alejandra

texts.es:
Marissa es una mujer  honesta, sincera y muy trabajadora.  Como muchas mujeres ha tenido que ser  madre y padre a la vez de sus  2 hijos: Manuel Alejandro de 12 años, estudiante de secundaria y Antonia Margarita de 5 años que asiste a pre-escolar.
Ella inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra, ya que aunque tiene un trabajo como soldadora en una empresa privada, el sueldo no le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Comenzó en el mes de Enero de 2006, pero antes tuvo que irse a trabajar a los Estados Unidos un año para poder juntar dinero y después iniciar su negocio. Cuando regreso de allá se trajo unas pacas de ropa usada y le fue muy bien, y ahora se las mandan de allá o cuando tiene vacaciones o descansos aprovecha para ir a comprarlas personalmente.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 5,000 MXN que pagara en 4 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y poder ofrecerle más variedad de ropa a sus clientes en esta época de fin de año que se acerca.
texts.en:
Marissa is honest, sincere and hard-working. Like many women, she is raising her 2 children on her own. Manuel Alejandro (12) is in secondary school, and Antonia Margarita (5) is in pre-school.She started the business to supplement her income. Although she works as a welder in a company, her wages are not enough to cover her needs and those of her children.

After working in the United States for a year to earn money with which to go into business, she started up in January 2006. When she returned from the US, she brought some bales of used clothing and sold them succesfully. Now she gets used clothes shipped from the US or she travels there herself during vacations and holidays to buy merchandise in person.

She needs a loan of 5,000 MXN, which she wll repay in four months, to buy a bale of clothes and offer more variety to her customers during the forthcoming season.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bale of clothes

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma Kasimu is a Tanzanian micro trader. For three years now, he has been running a video show library in Dovya at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. He shows videos and sells a variety of video cassettes, though he does not own the business room. He plans to construct and have his own satellite dish but he is limited by funds. He requests a loan of Tshs 600,000 to step up the plan.

loans.use: To expand video show business

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en: Kheun K., 40, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He is a very responsible man to his family and is always providing them with what they need. He is married with four children; all of them are single and are going to school. He works on a staff of a non-governmental organization (CMAC). He currently receives a salary of $180 a month, and has been working since 2001. Hs wife's, Noeun Yorng, 36, is a local tailor. She provides clothes for the local village, and all her customers recognize her excellent service. For additional income, she is also a rice farmer. K. and his family's living conditions are not great because the house is too small for them. He would like a loan to repair and decorate his old house and for additional money for his wife's rice farming.

loans.use: to repair and decorate his old house

loans.name: Bunyad

texts.en:
Bunyad (his wife is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in Bala Bahmanli village.

5 years ago, they decided to start their cattle breeding business. Now they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy 2 calves to improve their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Nasri

texts.en: Nasri is a 51-year-old married man with two children, living in Houla, southern Lebanon. He has owned a tow truck for 9 years, servicing the surrounding villages of Houla. Today, he is requesting US$ 1,200 in order to perform maintenance on his tow truck for better safety.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on the tow truck

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Mercy C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, aged 8 and 12. Mercy has been running a craft and a livestock business since 2005. She raises pigs and sells them when they grow up. She works at the business for 9-12 hours every day, six days a week and is assisted by one employee. Mercy currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to renovate her pig sty. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mercy thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her pig sty

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en: Leilani A., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the villagers/general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Leilani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: For cooking supplies

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El sr Anibal B. tiene 45 años y es casado con la sra Catalina Cardozo con quien tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, de 13 y 6 años respectivamente.

El cliente y su esposa tienen un microcomercio en su domicilio de ventas de ropas, sábanas, edredones, remeras, vaqueros, calzados deportivos, etc. Dicho negocio es atendido por su esposa (Catalina) quien tiene asi la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos y también de la microempresa.

Adicionalmente el Sr Anibal, para ayudar con la economía de la canasta familiar, cuenta con otro ingreso ya que  hace ya seis años  se dedica como  chofer de taxi, en la Parada Nº 32 de la  ciudad de Asunción situada en la esquina del Departamento de Identificaciones.

Ambos están esforzándose y ayudándose para  poder  brindar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, y asi poder cumplir sus sueños  que es el de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Anibal B. is 45 years old and married to Catalina Cardozo. They have two children together who are 6 and 13 years old. The couple runs a small shop out of their home selling clothes, sheets, comforters, sports shoes etc. Catalina is the one who actually works in the shop, because it allows her to be at home for her children. In addition to this business, Anibal earns another income as a taxi driver, thus helping to support the household's needs. He has been driving a taxi for 6 years, operating out of Stop # 32 in Asuncion city, right on the corner near the governmental Department of Records. Both Anibal and Catalina are working hard and supporting each other so that they can offer the children a better quality of life. They also dream of finishing construction on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food and drink

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is a resident of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2008, and she is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 pesos to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for farming.

Imelda is also thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help the poor people and encourages them to work hard for their future. She wishes to have a better living in the future and to give her children a good future.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis F. is 26 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. Both of her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, which is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Mavis is a trader who sells ice water. She sells at the lorry station in her community. She buys sachets of water from the distributers who come in vans to sell at wholesale prices. Mavis has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to buy sachets of water on larger scale. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy sachets of water

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells medicine in retail. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is a single parent and has two children. She has received schooling through vocational education. Since 2004, Alice has been making a living selling processed fish at Denu: she buys the fresh fish from the fishermen, takes them home for processing, and then brings them to the market for sale. Alice uses her income to pay bills. Currently, she needs a loan, which she will use to buy fish for resale. With the new profits, Alice plans to expand the business and help her children in pursuing further education.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Living in a hacienda (sugar plantation) is very tough. People work long hard hours for low wages that are not even enough to feed a family of four, much less a family with seven children. But Mrs. Marlyn C. of Hacienda Victoria, Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental was determined to help her husband support their large family, and send her children to school.

For the past twelve years, since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marlyn has engaged in food vending, selling a variety of nutritious snack food such as sugar-coated fried bananas, commonly known as "bananaque" because the bananas are sold skewered on barbecue sticks, to her neighbors and the surrounding communities within the sugar plantation where she lives.

In addition to food vending, Marlyn has a "sari-sari" or general store which her husband manages while she goes around selling her snacks to the field workers and their neighbors. The income they jointly earn helps in sending the three youngest children to school.

For her 9th loan, Marlyn is borrowing Php 9,500 to purchase a "trisikad" - a bike with a side-car so that she can use to go around the neighboring communities a lot faster and reach further to sell her snack food. Some of the loan will be used as additional capital for her food-vending and for the "sari-sari" (general) store.

Explaining the term "trisikad":

Filipinos are fond of coining new terms for the practical gizmos we dream up. Some of you might have read some "Only in the Philippines" anecdotes - and the trisikad is another one of those. The term trisikad is a combination of an English and Hiliganon (a dialect in Western Visayas) word - tricycle because of the three wheels (the bike + sidecar) - but then the term tricycle is already used for motorcycles with sidecars so to distinguish it, and to emphasize that it is not motorized, the Hiligaynon word "sikad" meaning to kick or to pedal was used instead - resulting in the uniquely Ilonggo "trisikad".


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business and to buy a trisikad

loans.name: Remberto Simeon

texts.es:
"Don Remberto M. P., tiene 46 años de edad y vive en la zona de Villa Victoria  en casa familiar, el señor se dedida a trabajar como chofer propietario de taxi por la zona de la Buenos Aires, su esposa se dedica a la venta de desayunos, los mismos tienen 3 hijos que aun se encuentran estudiando en colegio.
El crédito solicitado es para realizar el mantenimiento preventivo de la movilidad, ya que don Remberto es una persona responsable, es por eso que cuida su movilidad."

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
K. Doreen is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 30 years old and married with children who are all in school. She has had a hotel business in Kanyarugiri for over 3 years.

Her loyalty, accompanied by quality food and loans make it possible for Doreen to succeed.  Doreen prepares all kinds of local food and sauce.  She needs a loan to help expand her hotel with more variety of foodstuffs.  This can help her provide her children with a quality education. 

She is grateful for her loans since she is gaining from all of them.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her hotel and paying school fees.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa C. is from the village of San Jose, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Melissa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Melissa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing shirt making services to local community members. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Melissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Melissa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, ella es natural de Quillabamba la ciudad el eterno verano; ubicada ahora en la ciudad del Cusco.
