Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, ella se separo de su pareja y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia compra ropa de lima, y otras ciudades y las vende aquí en Cusco, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería y así tener más oportunidades de ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

Nuestra socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago establecido mediante el cronograma en el tiempo fijado.
texts.en:
Georgina belongs to the community bank Ayni. She is originally from Quillabamba, the city of eternal summer. Now she lives in Cusco. She is 54 years old, separated from her husband, and a single mother of two. She alternates her responsibilites at home with running a small business. She buys clothes in Lima and other cities to sell in Cusco. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest in buying more merchandise so she has the opportunity to offer variety to her clients. She values and appreciates the loan given through Kiva and promises to fulfill her payment within the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing to sell

loans.name: Judith Genoveva

texts.en:
Judith is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from Lima and has lived in Cusco for the last five years. She is 35 years old and is married with one child, who is studying at the University of Cusco.

She has been a culinary-education professor in Cusco for the past five years. She teaches how to cook Peruvian, Andian and international cuisines. She also has a catering business where she cooks for weddings and parties. There are usually many events at the end of the month. With this loan, she will buy items to augment her catering business.

Judith Genoveva appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her catering business

loans.name: Ann

texts.es: Ann es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son mayores de edad. Ann se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es cerrajero. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de insumos para vender salchipapas (comida al paso).  Este crédito de 1500 soles, será invertido en la compra de artículos de lencería para venderlos. La meta de Ann es llegar a tener un negocio de plásticos.
texts.en:
Ann is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. She is 46 years old, and the mother of four children of whom two are adults. Ann manufactures clothing in the small sewing workshop located in her home. She has the support of her husband, who works as a locksmith.

She joined the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank four years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase ingredients for preparing and selling “salchipapas” (a form of fast food consisting of potatoes and sausages). This loan in the amount of 1500 soles will be used to buy lingerie items to sell. Her goal is to have a business selling plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie to sell

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag S. is a 32 year-old single mother and lives with her 7 year-old son, her mother and younger brother in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is already a student in a local secondary school. Tungalag has done various small businesses to earn income for her family. She used to grow vegetables, grind flour, work in construction and sew traditional clothing for locals. Since 2003, she has been working in construction with her brother during warm seasons. When construction halts during winter, she sews traditional clothing for locals. Her mother taught Tungalag how to sew traditional clothing. She says that she can do any type of job and eventually would like to settle down and do what is best for her and her family. She requests a loan to purchase silk and other necessary materials for her sewing business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase silk and other necessary materials

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Fanny desde hace varios años, tiene una tienda de ropa variada en un modulo del mercado, es ropa de segunda que vende en buen estado y buen precio. Lo inicio con la necesidad de poder apoyar a sus cinco hijos de los cuales todos son mayores y a su esposo con algunos gastos. Con el tiempo dos hijos emigraron  a los Estado Unidos el cual recibe remesas, pero su mas deseo es poder volverlos haber. Sus planes es poner un establecimiento de ropa en su casa para aprovechar el vecindario ya que se vende mucho por su precio bajo ya que todo esta caro, y no se ajusta ni para la canasta básica de muchas familias Nicaragüenses por la posición económica del país. El desequilibrio, el desempleo son algunos factores de esta crisis. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar varias pacas para aumentar las ventas y poder ganar más dinero, en este mes de diciembre se vende bastante. Es por eso la necesidad de aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
For several years Fanny has had a store selling various clothes in a stall in the market. She sells second hand clothes that are in good condition for a good price. She started because she needed to be able to help her five children, who are all grown, and her husband with some expenses. In time, two children emigrated to the United States. They send money, but her biggest wish is to be able to see them again. Her plan is to set up a clothing establishment in her house to profit from being in the neighborhood. She sells a lot because her prices are low. Everything is expensive, and many Nicaraguan families cannot afford the basics in food because of the economic situation in the country. Hardships and unemployment are some of the factors in this crisis. With this loan she wants to buy various bundles to increase sales and be able to earn more money. In this month of December there are plenty of sales. That is why she needs to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various bundles of clothes to increase sales

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca T. is from the city of Castillo Concepcion Tarlac. She is 54 years old. Francisca is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Francisca is just starting this business.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering Central and Northern Luzon. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es: El negocio de las señora Rosario de Fátima R. B. consiste en mercadería por encargo ella vende desde ropa, joyas, adornos, zapatos  entre otros productos. Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad  de productos que los clientes demandan e invertir en nuevos rubros.
texts.en:
The business of Sra. Rosario de Fátima R. B. consists of selling commissioned merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, ornaments, shoes, and other products. She will use this loan to buy more products so that she can meet her customers’ demands and invest in new items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, ornaments, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has been selling perfumes, accessories and clocks for the past 15 years. He used to travel in his town and its surroundings to sell his products. Over the years, he devloped  a large customer base.  In 2007, he opened a small shop specializing in beauty products, perfumes and all kinds of accessories. Ali is very happy with his new business because it allows him to make a good income. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his business merchandise.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Rodríguez O. el se desempeña como acarreador de arena de una bloquera ubicada en somotillo  es de ahí donde el señor sacas las cuotas para el pago del crédito.
El a tenido 2 créditos con nuestra institución los cuales los cancelo en tiempo y forma sin retraso alguno Jorge nos dice que los créditos con CEPRODEL lo han ayudado mucho a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez O. works as a sand hauler for a concrete block factory located in Somotillo. His salary provides the money to repay the loan. He has had two previous loans with our institution which he repaid on time with no delays. Jorge tells us that CEPRODEL's loans have been very helpful to him in accomplishing improvements to his life and to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement.

loans.name: Betsi

texts.es:
Betsi es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Betsi es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Betsi vende comida típica en su casa, actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Betsi se dedica a la preparación de tortas y postres a pedido.
Betsi necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, gelatina, azúcar.
Betsi sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y progresar.
texts.en:
Betsi is a member of the Perla (Pearl) communal bank. Betsi is married, 50 years old and has 4 children. She sells typical meals in her home on Sundays. In addition, Betsi makes cakes and desserts to order. Betsi needs 1200 soles to buy flour, gelatin and sugar. Betsi dreams that her children become professionals and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, gelatin, sugar.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos aún dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la pesca desde hace mas de 21 años. Empezó a trabajar como tripulante en las embarcaciones de la zona y poco a poco fue saliendo adelante, actualmente es propietario de una chalana (Embarcación menor, de fondo plano, proa aguda y popa cuadrada, que sirve para transportes en aguas de poco fondo) con la cual se hace a la mar para pescar. Esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos por lo que trata de esforzarse al máximo para tener éxito en su negocio.

Los productos que Simón logra extraer los ofrece en venta a los comerciantes que compran los pescados en la playa. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido construir su vivienda y la está construyendo poco a poco. El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de nuevas redes para realizar su labor de modo mas eficiente.

Simon es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Simon is 42 years old, married, and has five dependent children. He lives with his family in the District of Santa Rosa, which is located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. The local economy is dependent on fishing.

Simon has been working in the fishing industry for more than 21 years. He began working as a crew member for the local fishing boats and slowly was able to get ahead. Simon now owns a “chalana” (a small flat-bottomed boat that can maneuver through shallow water) with which he uses to head out to sea in order to fish. This activity is his only source of income, so he puts in his best effort so that he can be successful in his business.

Simon sells the products he catches to the vendors who buy fish at the beach. Thanks to his work, he was able to gradually build his home. He is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN because he plans to buy new fishing nets so that he can carry out his work more efficiently. Simon is a father who is devoted to his family and greatly enjoys his work. He previously worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina is a trader; she buys bread in large quantities and supplies her customers at their business places. She does this trade to make a living and help her husband, who is a commercial driver, take care of the family. She started this business six years ago and before that she sold foodstuffs. She is focused on making sure she meets the demands of her customers, which she says will also lead to increase in profit.

Aina is 34 years old, married and has four children. She is a member of LAPO microfinance with a good record. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more bread to sell. This will enable her to get numerous customers and make more profit. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa D. est un commerçant qui gére une boutique de vente de piéces détachées au niveau de la gare routière .c'est un habitué des crédits ce qui l'a permis aujourd'hui d'avoir sa propre boutique .Ainsi il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité génératrice de revenu pour pouvoir son foyer en bon père de famille et s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D. is a trader who runs a spare parts store at the bus station. He is used to credit which enabled him today to have his own store. He is thus requesting this loan in order to strengthen his income generating business to take care of his household as the good father of the family and also to take care of the educatiuon of his children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Virginia Valconcha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia V.(right), 52 years of age, married, is a resident of Cogon, Ozamiz City. Virginia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virginia V.’s Group. 	

Virginia is married to Manuel, 56 years old, a farmer. They are blessed with 3 children, all now at their adult age. To help her husband, she decided to engage in business particularly in Ready To Wear buy and sell business. For 10 years, she has been able to maintain this business during ups and downs. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP2,000.00 a month. This amount is so helpful to their family income. She joined the cooperative in the year 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of PHP4,000.00 as her 2nd cycle loan availment to add her capital for her existing Ready To Wear buy and sell business. 
The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs and savings for future use. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing RTW buy and sell business.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabali, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce, de condiments, des légumes et des poissons frais.
Ces femmes du groupe Sabali sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
BABINTOU T. du groupe Sabali compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des céréales qui sera transformées en galettes.
Elle s’approvisionne en céréales le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17 500F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group are all married, are on average 47 years old with three children, and live in traditional extended families in Fatiana, a village in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro Region ( 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women in the Sabali group became acquainted through family ties, are retail vendors of condiments, vegetables and fresh fish, and are now requesting their first group loan. Babintou T. wants to use her loan to buy cereal and make flatcakes. She gets her supplies generally in Nangola and the surrounding area, and sells her products locally, at the Nangola market, and at market fairs in the vicinity, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 17,500 FCFA which will be used to cover her daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereal

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.en: T. Tukhta is 48 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. Tukhta has an experience of seven years preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. Tukhta is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, Tukhta is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, she requests 1,000 USD to purchase apricots with the purpose of processing and making dried apricots to increase the range of her selling goods. Tukhta expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more apricots in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
N. Ruth is 18 years-old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has one child who is seven months old.  Ruth has a business running a retail and grocery shop which sells small goods and food items in Kyotera.  

To expand her business, Ruth is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more inventory and food  which Ruth will sell at her shop and grocery.  Ruth hopes to expand her business and sell more types of items which can draw more customers and benefit her and her family. 

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. First, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more retail and food goods.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Hubert de 30 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Los días de Amelia comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, que junto a su esposo recorren una hora de caminata, hasta llegar a sus cultivos, es ahí donde comienzan su labor diaria, trabajando en la tierra, cultivando alverja, papa y zanahoria, siendo productos de buena calidad, motivo por el cual son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, de esa manera han transcurrido 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil doscientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Amelia is 32 years old and is a simple hard working woman. She lives in her parents’ house, along with her 30 year old husband, Humbert. What she wants most is to excel in life by overcoming its obstacles. Amelia’s days begin early in the morning, when she and her husband walk for an hour to get to where their crops are. This is where they begin their daily chores; working the land, raising peas, potatoes and carrots. Since their crops are of good quality, they are sought after in central market in Tarma. What they enjoy most about their work is caring for their crops. They’ve been doing this for eight years and they consider the most difficult part to be transporting their goods to Tarma, because the sacs they carry are very heavy and it wears them out. In the future they would like to buy some more land so that they can increase their production. This will be their sixth loan through MFP and they expect to be on time with their payments, because they don’t want to cause problems for their communal group. They will use the 1,200 PEN ($450) to buy fertilizer to improve their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La señora Arminda tiene 53 años de edad, es una madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos un joven de 24 y una señorita de 23, ella nos cuenta que crio a sus hijos sola, trabajando duro cada día y dandole a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, actualmente sus hijos ya son casados y ahora ella vive sola, y tiene una tienda llamada Tienda Mirna la tienda tiene 6 años de existir, doña Arminda ya no trabaja, solamente se dedica a su tienda, y su tienda le da para poder mantenerse, sin embargo sus clientes ahora le piden otros productos que no tienen y para poder complacer a sus clientes es que solicita este crédito para poder surtir mas su tienda y no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arminda is 53 years old and is a single mother; she has 2 children, a 24 year old young man and a 23 year old young woman. She tells us that she raised her children by herself working hard everyday and giving her children everything they needed. At present, her children are married and Mrs. Arminda lives by herself and has a store called Tienda Mirna, the store is 6 years old and she only works in the store since it provides enough to sustain her. Her customers now ask her for products that she does not have and to please them she needs the loan to stock her store and she won’t loose her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandize.

loans.name: Eduardo Humberto

texts.es:
Eduardo de 32 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), es tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas. 

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a reparar bicicletas, pero por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que comenzar a trabajar reparando bicicletas para poder mantener a su familia. Poco a poco readecuo su taller. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas, cadenas y herramientas para su taller de bicicletas, en el futuro quiere tener talleres de reparación.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 32 years old. He lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban zone with an ecology that is being revitalized). He has a bicycle repair shop. Starting when he was a small boy, his father taught him how to repair bicycles. Because of the lack of opportunities, he had to start repairing bicycles in order to support his family. Little by little, he set up his workshop. With the loan, he would like to buy tires, chains and tools for his bicycle workshop. in the future, he would like to open more repair shops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bicycle tires and chains

loans.name: Sandra Ruth

texts.es:
Sandra P. tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad de Bogotá la capital de Colombia, allí tiene su negocio de vender telas, confeccionar cortinas y lencería, actividad con la que ha logrado sostener su hogar  y especialmente a su único hijo de 16 años, a quien sueña con verlo convertir en un profesional exitoso.
Sandra inició su negocio cuando se independizó de su madre hace 2 años, porque desde muy joven trabajó con ella el oficio de confecciones y venta de telas , ahora logró tener un local donde exhibir su mercancía  y vender los productos de lencería  que ella elabora y con los cuales ha tenido mucha cogida entre sus clientes, porque aprovecha  que además en los alrededores de este negocio,  no existen otros que desarrollen la misma actividad así que está muy bien ubicada, en la zona comercial del sur de Bogotá  en el barrio Bosa. En la actualidad reúne todas las condiciones para hacer un credikiva, pues necesita surtirse para la segunda temporada del año, época en la que mas concurren los clientes a su negocio, porque viene las fiestas prenavideña como la del   amor y la amistad,  las ya conocidas navideñas y por esta razón su negocio  debe estar provisto de telas e insumos para la confección de cortinas, elaboración de manteles y  otros productos con motivos navideños que tiene encargados y que también necesita exhibirlos para venderlos. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y continuar ampliando su negocio mediante un surtido muy moderno y actualizado como le piden sus clientes, porque ella siempre ofrece lo que está de moda.
.
texts.en:
Sandra P., age 39, lives in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. That is where she has her business of selling fabrics and making curtains and linens. With this activity she has managed to support her household, especially her only child, age 16. She dreams of seeing him become a successful professional. Sandra started her business when she became independent from her mother two years ago. Ever since she was very young she has worked at the job of making and selling fabrics. She has now managed to have a place where she displays her merchandise and sells the linen products that she makes. Her products have been very well received by her customers. She benefits from the fact that there is no one else in the surrounding area that does the same activity that she does. She is very well located in the commercial area in the southern part of Bogotá in the Bosa neighborhood. She currently meets all of the conditions to have a Kiva loan. She needs to stock up for the second season of the year. During this time more customers gather at her business. The before Christmas festivities like St. Valentine’s Day, as well as the Christmas festivities, are approaching. That is why her business needs to be supplied with fabric and supplies to make curtains, tablecloths, and other products with Christmas motifs that she is responsible for. She also needs to display them in order to sell them. Her dream is to have her own house. She also dreams of continuing to expand her business with a very modern and updated stock that her customers request. She always offers what is in style.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and supplies to make curtains, tablecloths, and other products with Christmas motifs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 60-year-old widow and a mother of nine children aged between 17 and 40. Mary supports a family of four because most of her children have their own families. Mary runs a mini retail shop, which she started three years ago. This business gives her an average profit of 5,000 KES per month.

This is Mary's third loan and she is requesting to borrow 20,000 KES, of which 5,000 KES will be used to buy one bag of sugar, 3,000 KES to buy two boxes of tea leaves, and 2,000 KES to purchase two boxes of bar soap. The balance of Kes 10,000 will be used to pay school fees for two of her children. Mary hopes to use her business profits to expand the business and save for future use. 

Mary's hopes and dreams are to expand her business to wholesale and have her own car.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr: Monsieur  Djibril  D. est un pêcheur  qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il  a 40 ans, il est  marié et  père de 4 enfants. Il évolue  dans le secteur de la pêche depuis plus de 25 ans et parallèlement  il élève des moutons qu’il revend pendant les périodes de fêtes. Il  l’a choisit l’activité  de pêche  parce que depuis tout jeune il accompagnait son père  pécher. En plus c’est une activité qui rapporte beaucoup. Il est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis  mars 2004. Il a déjà bénéficié de 5  prêts  qu’il a  payés correctement. Cette fois ci il sollicite un prêt de 500  000  prévu pour  l’achat de moutons  destinés a la vente  pendant la période de  tabaski  . Avec les revenus tirés  de son opération il envisage  de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer sa situation sociale
texts.en: Mr.  Djibril  D. is a fisherman who lives in Yoff. He is 40, married, and the father of four children. He has been working in fishing for more than 25 years and at the same time, he raises sheep that he sells during the holy/feast days. He chose the business of fishing because when he was a boy, he accompanied his father who was a fisherman. Moreover, it is a business where you earn a lot. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2004. He has already been accorded five loans which he repaid correctly. This time he is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy sheep destined to  be resold during Tabaski (a Muslim feast day). With the income from this deal, he intends to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in sheep to fatten for resale

loans.name: Leonor Flor

texts.es:
Leonor de 55 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa,  vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Hace 10 años empezó con una pequeña tienda de dulces ya que tenia 8 hijos que mantener y esta separada de su esposo. Desde entonces ha venido trabajando por ellos para que tengan una buena vida y puedan estudiar. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Su tienda esta ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa, vende bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados, etc. Una de los problemas que tiene para atender la tienda es que su mama esta delicada de salud y necesita pasar mas tiempo con ella. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, enlatados para surtir mas su tienda ya que quiere agrandarla. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito, y poder expandir su tienda en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Leonor, 55, has a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a canton called, Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations rich in seafood.

Ten years ago she started with a small candy store because she had 8 children to support and she’s separated from her husband.  Since then she has been working for them so that they have a good life and go to school.

She is open for business from 6am until 11pm every day.  Her store is in the front of her house.  She sells beverages, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc.  One of the difficulties she has in tending to the store is that her mother is in delicate health and she must spend more time with her.

She wants to buy beverages and canned goods with the loan to better stock her store because she wants to enlarge it.  In the future she wants her children to successfully finish their schooling and to be able to extend her business to other places.

loans.use: For rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 56 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, tiene una carnicería, vive con sus hijos, es una señora muy trabajadora, ella quedo al pendiente D. este negocio desD. que su esposo falleció, la carnicería tiene ya 30 años D. existir, siendo el ingreso del hogar para solventar los gastos, su venta es D. carne, costilla D. res y los derivados del ganado.
Ella quiere comprar más reces para el destazo y D. esta manera darle una mejor atención a la demanda por parte D. los clientes, con este préstamo mejorará su inventario teniendo siempre carne disponible para la venta; su propósito es crecer con el número D. clientes,  tener un negocio estable y en condiciones para competencia.
texts.en:
Doña María ia 56 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. She has a butcher shop and lives with her children. She is a very hard-working woman. She has depended on this business since her husband died. The butcher shop has already been in existence for 30 years, providing the household income to pay expenses. She sells meat, beef ribs, and cattle byproducts.

She wants to buy more cattle to butcher so that she can better meet the demands of her customers. With this loan, she will improve her inventory so that she always has meat ready to sell. Her aim is to increase the number of customers and have a stable, competetive business.

loans.use: Buy cattle to butcher

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 45 years old. She is married to a pastor and has eight children who are between seven and twenty three years old. All her children go to school. Asia owns a hairdressing salon and has been doing this business for a period of four years. 

Asia requested this loan to buy more beauty products which will attract more ladies to use her salon.  She is planning to build a house from the profit that will be made  from this business. She dreams to own a house with two floors in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for sale

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson tiene 34 años, vive con su esposa, su hijo y su padre en una casa que le fue heredada por su familia. Desde hace 4 años decidió generarse su propia fuente de ingreso, ofreciendo el servicio de transporte, en la que posee un moto taxis, recorriendo todas las calles de su localidad. El trabajo que realiza es diario y solo descansa un día a la semana, menciona además, que este trabajo tiene sus riesgos, pero sabe también que tiene su recompensa, para él lo mas importante es generar ingresos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Por otro lado también se dedica a la siembra de alfalfa, ya que tiene una granja de cuyes, en donde su esposa es la encargada de cuidarlos y  alimentarlos. Su meta es tener otra movilidad más y tener una granja de cuyes más amplia. Es el crédito número 13 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de llantas para la compra de llantas nuevas y también para comprar abono y sembrar alfalfa que sirve de forraje para los cuyes.
texts.en:
Emerson is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife, his son, and his father in a house that he inherited from his family. Four years ago, he decided to start his own transportation business. He has a motorcycle taxi and rides throughout the streets of his town. He works six days a week and has one day off. He adds that the this job has its risks, but he also knows that it has its reward. For him, the most important thing is being able to earn a living and offer his family a better quality of life.

He also grows alfalfa on the side because he has a guinea pig farm, and his wife is in charge of caring for and feeding them. His goal is to obtain another vehicle and expand his guinea pig farm. This is his 13th loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support. Furthermore, he is pleased to be a part of his communal bank because all its members are responsible and very united. He gives thanks to the people who will make this loan possible because it will be quite useful for the progress of his business. He will invest this loan in purchasing new tires and purchasing fertilizer so that he can plant alfalfa for his guinea pigs.

loans.use: Purchase new tires and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta de ladrillos hace mas de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio por su familia ya que anteriormente ellos se hacían cargo del negocio y con el paso del tiempo le enseñaron a Miguel a ganarse la vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su actividad pues le gusta mucho elaborar este tipo de productos. Este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Sueña con ampliar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel is 32 years old. He sells bricks and has had this business for more than eight years. He started because of his family because before, they were in charge of the business, and over time they taught Miguel how to earn a living. He is a very hardworking person and he enjoys his work, so he would really like to make this type of product. This loan that he is requesting is to purchase the basic materials necessary for his business. He dreams of growing his business day by day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta K. M. is forty-seven years old, single and has eight children aged between thirty years and five years old. Her business is located at Kithyoko and is served by Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

She has been selling such items as detergents, soft drinks, tea leaves, sugar and others for the last year to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She also hopes to start a grocery store from which she will make more income. She describes herself as ambitious, caring, peaceful, and responsible.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, sugar, flour, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is a member of the “Unidos Para Progresar” (Unite to progress) 1 & 2. a group compound with ten micro businesspeople in clothing sales, shoes, food sales, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the most rural cities in the country whose economy depends on agriculture. Miguelina is a mother of three children and she live together with her long term partner. She started her business with the first loan she got from Esperanza. She is receiving her 9th loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. good investments.

She is currently operating a "Combustible or fuel sales”. She is planning to use the new loan to buy fuel from retailers and sell it by bottles or gallons in her community. She will use profits to save, because she wants to improve her business and make her dreams and most difficult challenges come true.  She wants to have and build her own house, in a safe structure.  Her favorite pastime is to be with her children.

loans.use: to buy fuel.
